Reviews.Title: “Service!”
Reviews.Author: Charlie S
Reviews.Content: When we stay in any hotel the most important factor is service and the Hotel de Noailles in Paris has it in spades. The staff couldn't do enough for us. They were so helpful in giving directions, advising on where to eat and arranging taxis. Their pleasant manner and real interest in us helped make our Paris trip memorable. The hotel is clean, modern, really funky with a great location. A great place to stay, so enjoy! Eleanor Spain Kamloops BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “cool design & kind ｒeception”
Reviews.Author: wakame0106
Reviews.Content: A hotel is clean and the interesting object is put on the lobby ＾＾ Breakfast has cereal scrambled eggs pickle etc. in several kinds of pans and hams. It was all delicious and I was satisfied. Some staff to whom other languages can reply in addition to French and English seems to be. Although the staff whom Japanese people can answer seemed to have been absent, he was very kindly in agreement. This hotel is on the location as on foot 3 minute from Teatro dell'Opera, and is very convenient. However, since the small alley is faced, a way may be incomprehensible when going for the first time... Stay of Paris was able to be enjoyed fully in the very wonderful hotel. I would like to use very much again.

Reviews.Title: “small , friendly and very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: tractorboy59
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights to watch Rugby and see Paris . This hotel was well located near to the opera metro , and within easy walking distance of many Paris sites . The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful ,giving us good advice on restaurants and travel/sites . Breakfast is simple but very good - lovely jams and good choice . The hotel does Breakfast only but there are many local restaurants catering from cheap to extremely pricy - some of the mid range are excellent but 100 euros for 2 people . Only drawback is the bar which is virtually non-existant bar , but there are many local bars which have extended happy hours every night . We would certainly use the hotel again Although the rooms are small , they are comfy and the shower is excellent . The rooms at the fron are noisy with the windows open

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding room, excellent service, will return in future”
Reviews.Author: jbsmith13
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through BA as they had a great deal of 1 night free and free wifi access. After booking I emailed the hotel to see if I could upgrade to room 602 which was a superior room, they did this at a discounted rate of only 20euro per night. It was amazing it had a oval shaped bath in the corner of the room, a king size bed and walled mount TV with a few English films we managed to find. Cleaners came in everyday, tidied around, refilled the toiletries, changed the towels and also would changed the sheets if you left the note. This room has a huge balcony as it is right on the top floor (6th and there is a lift) it has great views of the roof tops and a table and chairs which you could eat breakfast on if you asked for it to be delivered in the morning. We went downstairs for breakfast, which had croissants, pain au chocolats, bread, cake, crepes, cereals, scrambled egg, sausages, fresh juice, bottle water, coffee and tea. When you were going out the hotel requested you left your key at reception, this is just for safely so keys are not lost and they are quiet heavy with the unique keyrings! The location of the hotel is amazing it is 1minute walk from Opera Metro and also 1minute walk from another metro. Walking distance to Louvre - 10mins, start of champs Elysees 15mins, shopping centre -5mins and plenty of places to eat and shop around Opera. We did not eat or drink in the hotel we always were out, we did try Drouant which is just down the road which is so good! especially the lamb! Would certainly stay here again in future. Staff were very pleasant and helpful during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “romantic break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Angela E
Reviews.Content: This hotel took us totally by surprise as it was a package deal with British Airways. The room was very spacious and comfortable and had the benefit of a balcony overlooking the front 5 floors up (not very good for the vertigo!). Even though we travelled february/March we still enjoyed a few glasses of wine al fresco. The hotel was very central and most attractions reached easily either on foot or metro. The staff were extremely helpful and polite at all times from arrival to departure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and affordable hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: francoisel
Reviews.Content: We've spent a week end in Paris this winter and reserved a room at the hotel De Noailles. Very close from the Opera and the Grands Magasins, very close also from the Tuileries and Faubourg St Honoré, this hotel host a collection of contemporary art; They upgraded us to a junior suite with a balcony on the patio. Lovely week end! www.hotelnoailles.com

Reviews.Title: “Take the Long View!”
Reviews.Author: AlanMillsAlpha
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review of the Noailles about 10 days ago and could not understand why it had not been posted. Then realised that it was because I was not logged in with a Trip Advisor password.......! So tried again and was welcomed with a thankyou for my review...sigh of relief I did not have to remember everything I said..............except that the review for which I received thanks dates from 2005! C'est la Vie!, still 9 people liked it so lets see if I can do better this time. In fact having re-read my 2005 comments I am not sure if there is a great deal to add, except that nothing has really changed, the hotel still has the nicest staff I have ever encountered, the rooms are constantly refurbished, and the overall feeling is that the owners really care about the welfare of their guests. I was there in early January, for once with my partner (who has insisted on writing her own review) and the room and service were once again five star. I mentioned in my earlier review that I use the Noailles mostly for business. On my last trip in 2011 I failed to reserve at the Noailles early enough and I arrived from a Transatlantic flight to find that Paris was completely full (if you ignore rooms at the so called palaces starting at 1100 euros a night). I had no choice but to curtail my Paris stay and head for the UK later in the day on the Eurostar. What did the Noailles do? They stored my luggage for the day, found me a room for a couple of hours so that I could have a shower and provided me with one of their great breakfasts. I managed to get to two of my meetings and got my Eurostar, tired but very relieved. Service like that is simply gold dust and is one of the reasons why the Noailles continues to sit at the top of my list of places to stay in Europe. Alan Mills I

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff, Amazing Location, Amazing Stay and Amazing Style”
Reviews.Author: TravelAsYouGo
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris. I was not sure where to stay in the city, what area was safe, and read that Paris had many trashy hotels and I do not speak French. I hunted hard to find a hotel with high reviews and this one had so many. The bad few reviews clearly came from customers that must have been in a bad mood because the staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable every chance they could. Our flight was changed so that we had to arrive at 8am putting us at the hotel at 9am. I knew the chance of a room being ready this early was highly unlikely but we thought we could leave our bags. After being greeted warmly by the front desk person, we were told they had a room but it needed to be cleaned. We were told that they would send housekeeping to our room immediately and the room would be ready in an hour. We chatted in the lobby with the staff and the room was ready as promised. The hotel has a charm to it (charm does mean small) but it was so comfortable. The hotel is on a quiet street, just one street each direction to anything you need or want. Super high end shopping and typically shopping is just a few blocks, a short 10-minute walk to the Louvre, and less than ½ mile to most anything. Cafes are less than a 2-minute walk and a great breakfast pastry shop right across the street that puts out fresh pastry every morning. The room was on the smaller side but I have stayed in smaller. The room had a queen bed and about 2-feet on either side of the bed. The room had two steps up to walk behind the headboard that led to a large opening door that looked into the courtyard. I slept with my window open every night as the weather was so fantastic. The bathroom is spacious with an oversized stall shower with a wonderful rainfall shower head, separate toilette room and the whole room had amazing lighting. The room had a large Samsung flat screen TV. The TV had two English stations but I did not spend much time watching TV. The hotel also offers a lovely lobby bar and a bartender from Sri Lanka. He made an a fantastic drink and helped with local directions and information on the Metro. I only have nice things to say about this hotel and I would return and recommend it to anyone that asked. I always felt safe, welcome and slept so comfortably in my quite room and amazing shower. I am sure you could find larger rooms but from what I understand, it is hard to find a large room in Paris unless you can pay a super high price for the space. The funny thing, a few nights later in London we stayed in another beautiful but larger hotel and I kept thinking about how I loved the space in Paris and the way it made me feel. My boyfriend said that it was the charm and the staff that made it special not the square feet.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Golden Tulip Opera de Noailles”
Reviews.Author: Maria Christina f
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel!!! amazing staff!!! a hotel with charm, fantastic location, and mainly full of class! We are already planning to go back; Thank you for the hotel staff who could make me feel home! Maria Christina Fernandes

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Jewel in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia M
Reviews.Content: The hotel Opera de Noailles is one of the finest hotels in Europe my husband and I have ever stayed at. Situated in the very heart of Paris, near the Opera, the famous shopping centre Galeries Lafayettes and the Louvre, Opera de Noailles is a haven of peace where you can relax and unwind. Being an art lover, I was thoroughly impressed by the ultra-modern design combining art déco and the japanese zen both in the rooms and public areas. Upon arrival, our luggage was picked up immediately and sent to our room while check-in was a matter of minutes thanks to the efficient staff at the reception. As soon as we stepped into our room , we were speechless. We really felt like staying at a contemporary art museum, yet. reminiscent of Stendal's Le Rouge et le Noir! Only an artist could have decorated room 307 combining with skill the basic colours - red, black, white - in a modern design. This amazing decor goes hand in hand with comfort. Cleanliness in the room was impeccable! Breakfast was served in a cosy dining-room and consisted of a wide variety of French cheeses, croissants, rolls, pancakes, fruit and cereals, apple-pie(!), jams, scrambled eggs and sausages. Two smiling ladies welcomed us there every morning and made us feel like staying at a friend's home - not a hotel! Some of the best restaurants in Paris are situated at a short walking distance from the hotel-such as Le Petit Colbert which we loved and the japanese restaurant Nikko next door not to mention a wide range of bistrots and bars in the area. We would have loved a gourmet restaurant in the hotel, though. We would like to thank all the staff for being so kind and polite making our stay such a great pleasure. We only wish we could stay longer... but one thing's for sure. On our next visit to Paris, we will definitely choose Hotel Opera de Noailles!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Comfortable Beds and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Jennenz
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on all of the reviews here on TA and were for the most part very pleased. The location was fantastic, easy to walk to everything and the Opera and Place Vendome are a stone's throw away. The rooms were very comfortable- the beds awesome for weary travellers and when you are out walking all day- and we loved the huge window that opened into the courtyard. It was great to get fresh air in and there was even a nice place to sit if you wanted to sit by the window. The bathroom is nice and modern and they even had a blow dryer with a diffuser- a big bonus if you need it!! We didn't eat at the hotel so we cannot make a call on this, but i found the desk staff to be just okay. I found that asking them to call a taxi was putting them out some times but that is the only negative I would say so it is really nothing. Absolutely worth the value and a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable, very upmarket rooms, great friendly staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Denver G
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay there, wish we had been able to stay for a few more days. I cannot fault the hotel. The service was really amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Idefourny
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the Opera de Noailles. They offered me a competitive offer, as the first time I had reserved via British Airways at a discounted price. The location is super close to everything interesting, with a choice of restaurants in the area. The timing was not great, it was before Christmas and Paris was just too busy for my taste. The hotel was busy, but flawless - except the housekeeping service on one day which was not done till 3pm. The staff was as helpful and devoted as last time. A lady manager was also around, and she seemed to be the very active type. We had 2 rooms on the 6th floor, on the small side but this is Paris. One had a great terrace though not useful in December. The breakfast buffet is perfect, and plentiful. The breakfast ladies are so nice and attentive to your every need.

Reviews.Title: “A-way from the convention center”
Reviews.Author: craig0581
Reviews.Content: Some of the nicest employees working here. If you take the time to get to know them a bit, there are some really down to earth, willing to go the extra mile, stand-up employees here. Cleanliness: Decently maintained... the rugs in the hallways need to be thoroughly cleaned nearer the walls as they were filthy. Rooms: Pretty clean, bedrooms are a decent size. The bathrooms very small with a tiny shower, tiny toilet area (size of a port-o-john. Has all up to date modern appliances. Staff: Very polite to me, always at the front desk. Helpful with getting a cab (we wanted one that accepts credit cards). However... see cab problems below. Breakfast: Hmmm.... the breakfast spread , I enjoyed the fresh squeezed juice and coffee with my toast and pastry each morning. I could have had cereal, just didn't feel like it. The eggs... the scrambled eggs had the consistency of mashed potatoes... I didn't dare try them. Lunch / Dinner: The food was good, the seafood bar was outstanding! The desserts helped me understand why everyone praises French desserts... out of this world, rich in flavor!! Cab Problems: NOT problems with the hotel but with the cab drivers: They ALL agree to take you where you need to go, then pull over and take out their map halfway there, as you watch the meter keep rising you realize after the second taxi ride that this is clearly done on purpose... they are ALL crooks. Their other trick is to get lost on purpose so once again the meter rises up. Avoid this by walking. OR our common bald cabby in the van tells you straight up its 20 euro to go to the convention center that's literally 4 minutes away... I timed him! Oh and once you get there he will tell you his credit card machine is broken so ... cash only.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but not great....what am I missing?”
Reviews.Author: CowSong
Reviews.Content: was recommended this hotel as a great boutique hotel...but had to check if I had the same name and address of hotel that friend recommended, because I was disappointed. It was just okay and wouldn't recommend it...front desk staff was attentive when I checked in, but the key to get into the room was not easy at all...need to make an easier locking system. Going back at end of night, you shouldn't order mention on your website a bar if you don't have a bar attendant. the front desk attendant wasn't able to do double duty of attending to bar and greeting guests and ordering taxis. i had asked for another drink, but he was too busy. i really wanted to like this hotel as something special, but to me, there is notning special that I found. wifet was very slow too, but at least free!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: KesAustralia
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent. The internet was down in our room so they gladly offered for us to use their desk, at no charge. The staff, both in the breakfast area and service desk, were extremely helpful. Location is the best, within walking distance to all sights and in a small side street so no traffic noise. The rooms were clean and the maids were more than happy to say hello, even with the language barrier! We stayed 4 nights and would gladly return next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clutz7777
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a one night business trip in November. The hotel is fantastically located in a small side street near Opera, the Louvre and other attractions are within walking distance, and check out Place Vendome for some fantastic window shopping. The room was small but well appointed and very clean, as was the bathroom and the rest of the hotel, there was some work going on in the lobby but this was not intrusive. I ate out so cannot contribute about the restaurant but it seemed decent enough

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Navyroc
Reviews.Content: Well located, near Opera Garnier and Quatre-Septembre metro station, we enjoyed our stay from november 21st to 28th. Everything is just perfect. Premises are nice and clean, staff is courteous, even maids will say good morning when you come across them. We had breakfeast included and food was very good and abundent. If we ever come back in Paris, we will stay at that hotel for sure !

Reviews.Title: “Very good modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: rkahn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Golden Tulip Opera de Noailles for three nights November 10-13, 2011. We found our stay very enjoyable. The hotel has been completely renovated, including all rooms, bathrooms and public areas. Everything was clean and well kept up and the water pressure in the shower was excellent as was the water temperature. Everyone was very helpful and polite. We did not have the breakfast included so I cannot comment on it. A few cafes in the area were open for breakfast and were fine albeit nothing special. We expect to be staying there again next month as the location is absolutely excellent. Thanks for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and great location”
Reviews.Author: 2elephants
Reviews.Content: I really liked the funky decor, the room, while not huge, had a little outdoor patio and probably the best bathroom I've ever had in Paris. Clean and spotless, the presentation was excellent. Recommended!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “very solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lily T
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel during the first weekend of november. It was conveniently located in the opera district, a short walk away from the Louvre. the room was a good size for a couple and I was quite impressed with the bathroom - large, plenty of light and very modern. Front desk was friendly and I do like the added security of the front doors being shut late at night and you have to buzz to have the front desk clerk let you in. the bed was very comfortable and AC worked well. The only thing I can complain about is that during the next to last night, water from the room above us started dripping into our bathroom in the middle of the night, which caused a little bit of a puddle. As well, the next day when the cleaning ladies changed our towels, we were not given a new set of the smaller towels to replace the ones taken away (the room comes with 2 large and 2 smaller towels - we were not given the 2 smaller towels and so only had the 2 large towels). Also, this is may be a preference thing but there's no door/curtain that extends the entire length of the tub - there's only a glass barrier for the front half of tub and so if you're not careful taking a shower, you can splash water everywhere. Otherwise, i can't complain about the stay and the best part was that it was only a 5 min walk from the roissybus, which was amazingly easy to take.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for the Area”
Reviews.Author: Lizzt
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located Hotel. Lovely and Clean - rooms small but it is Paris and room was perfectly acceptable for a business trip. Staff very helpful. Will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “terrific location”
Reviews.Author: IslandGirl28
Reviews.Content: Convenient walk to Louvre and just a few blocks away from the Opera train station. the front desk people were helpful, we were also upgraded to a balcony room, and it was a lot bigger than our teeny Rome hotel. Loved pretty much everything about the hotel. I'm not sure I could have gotten a better room for the price esp given the convenient location. The 18 euro breakfast is way too overpriced though. (didn't try it) this has nothing to do w the hotel but do be careful of pickpocketers. There's a group of girls waiting when you get off the Roissy bus, their scheme is to ask you to sign a petition and then they try to pickpocket you when you're distracted. One actually touched my side. Got the heck out of there , no harm. will serve you well to be on alert.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JudithKula03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Hotel for 5 nights in Oct 2011 and we loved every minute of it. I have read the recent reviews on this page and I was there on the event of the hot water failing to work on one morning. This issue could happen at any hotel and I do not think it was the hotel employee’s fault. I find it harsh for people to give this hotel a bad review on an issue that was out of their control. This hotel was indeed very close to everything - the metro, restaurants, Gaumont Theatre, Rue de Rivoli and Avenue de l'Opéra with loads of shops. As for the shopping centre, Galleries Lafaette, it is within sight from the end of the street, being a 5min walk. You won’t even need the map to spot it, it’s massive you cannot miss it, you’ll find Lauderee there! YUM. Anyhow, do not be deterred from this fabulous hotel! We were certainly not disappointed, we loved it! It was clean, comfy bed, fantastic balcony, available fridge, helpful employees and sooo close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very beautiful and modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: ele75FFM
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Golden Tulip Opera de Noailles and was very impressed (I have seen terrible hotels in Paris). The hotel is very central, in the 2nd arrondissement, and just a 2-minutes walk from Opéra. The hotel is situated in a quiet side street. There are loads of restaurants in the area. I was upgraded to a luxury room and that was very beautiful. The hallway that lednup to the room wasn't that beautiful, but the room was modern, spacious and a luxurious bathroom. I paid 156 Euros, which I found very good value for money, because a lot of hotels were unavailable or very expensive during that day.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: leanne31085
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel after a long 24 hour flight from Australia. We booked this hotel because of all the great reviews on trip adviser. Well it certainly doesnt deserve them. Our room is small- which is fine its Paris, but I was disappointed to find we had no alarm clock (we didnt travel with cell phones) and no tea and coffee making facilities. There is also a sign on the fridge - "do not use the fridge for your own personal use" ummm arnt we paying for the room and the facilities? Ohwell the fridge wasnt even cold anyway. The third morning we woke up to no hot water in the room. I called reception and was rudely advised it was a problem across the whole hotel. There was no apology. This was not rectified for 24 hours and we were not offered a discount or a breakfast or anything. The next day I needed to find a department store to buy something, and asked where it was and for reception to call a taxi. The man at the counter was extremeley rude and told me he would not call me a taxi! I asked why and he said it was a 5 min walk. It was actually seven stops on the metro. Next time I will just walk to the taxi rank myself. For other travellers to know- there is nowhere to get breakfast before 10am on weekdays around this area and weekends hardly anything open. Maybe try to get the hotel breakfast included- that was the only highlight and the staff were welcoming. Looking forward to checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: OliverT
Reviews.Content: Although standard room was small, it was perfectly adequate in size for two. Plenty of closet space and a window seat that easily accommodated two suitcases. Spotlessly clean, ultra modern, great breakfast, flat screens and excellent a/c. Extremely quiet, never heard street noise or other guests. The staff could not be more pleasant. The area near the opera house has some fine restaurants close by, many of them open on Sundays. The bus from the airport arrives and departs just three short blocks away. Good deal on rates available through BA website. Recommended without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Clean and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lizz T
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Value for money and in a great area. The cleandliness of this hotel is outstanding. The rooms were suprisingly bigger than expected considering it was the centre of Paris. Staff were very helpful and had a lovely business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Pierre B
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in Paris where we travelled with a small group of friends. A small boutique style hotel with superb service offered by an attentive staff that far exceeded our expectations. After having stayed in larger hotels in Rome, Barcelona, Lisbon and a few other european cities, we we're amazed at the staff's attention to our few requests. The room, though smallish was well appointed with a very comfortable bed, great bathroom amenities and plenty of hot water! Breakfast was again above expectations and the location absolutely unbeatable. Found a great little restaurant a few blocks away, Le Petit Colbert, where we enjoyed three fine evenings with excellent food and wine.

Reviews.Title: “Far Exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: f a
Reviews.Content: I was worried about booking this hotel, as I was with every hotel in Paris.... the website pics and descriptions are never good and when it is, the room is 500+ Euros a night... so I took a shot and booked Noailles and I'm so glad I did... the location was central, 10-15 minute walk to Louvre, Marais, 5-8 minute cab ride to St Germain, or Eiffel... Staff was extremely friendly. and the lobby was clean and fresh... it did not look old and dingy as sometimes you fear. in fact the place was all newly updated and renovated. the best part about this hotel was our room... Although small, it was clean and new... not stains on the carpet, not busted tub, etc... it was comfortable, the AC worked properly, the water pressure was excellent... We were thrilled at how good this hotel was and we will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Tulip Opera De Noailles”
Reviews.Author: mjjba747
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant small, boutique-style hotel in small, quiet side street only one minute's walk from Metro station 'Quatre-Septembre'. Very nice, friendly, helpful staff. Excellent and fresh self-service continental breakfast with lots of hams, cheeses, fruits, yoghurts, toast, juice and friendly waitress service for tea & coffee. We had two standard rooms with modern decoration and very quiet with nice beds. These rooms were very tight on space for two people. The shower area was separated from the room by only a frosted glass screen with curtain and the floor was a bit slippery when wet. Nowhere to hang towels. The main irritations were:The double doors on each of the two wardrobes fortunately had no handles, so with only a slot in one door so we were constantly having to open that door in order to reach inside and open the other door. There is no space for handles so why don't they put a slot in each of the four doors so you don't keep breaking your nails? Inside, the safe door opened in the opposite direction to the wardrobe door necessitating opening both doors to get to the safe. A stylish but clumsy chair took up much of the room and would not fit under the desk so I left it in the corridor for all of our stay which actually allowed us to walk around a bit! I moved the desk along the wall so that the wardrobe doors could actually open without hitting it! Too many light switches were confusing and the bedside lamps were hot metal which caused me to burn my arm. The window (with sunshade) opened inwards so anything on the window sill got knocked off by it. As we had to put one suitcase on there we were constantly fighting the window and suitcase. Room design was clearly made for show and not practical use. Our rooms were nice but a very tight squeeze so I suggest that you get a slightly larger room. We couldn't as the hotel was full. Rooms were very quiet facing a pleasant inner courtyard and you could hang your washing on the window without annoying anyone!

Reviews.Title: “3 stars, but far from deserving 4”
Reviews.Author: SeamasterFrance
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at this hotel and enjoyed it despite some shortcomings. Pros: - Welcoming Lobby, lounge chairs, bar, atrium - Nicely appointed rooms with modern furniture - Very clean - Quiet Cons: - Overpriced for a deluxe room (3rd category gives you a 20 sqm room max) - Orange juice is not fresh which is unacceptable in a 4 star hotel - Check-out time at 11 AM: a first for me in the 40 hotels I tried in Paris - In-room breakfast stops at 10AM Conclusion: Would be great if the price was 20% less. At the current price, it's just way too expensive and you can find much better in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and quality of stay in the heart of Opera”
Reviews.Author: editcork
Reviews.Content: Having heard enough about poor room quality and high prices in Paris, I was surprised to stay in this moderately priced and high quality (strong 4*) hotel. The best part is unbeatable location if you have to stay in Opera, and it is also on the quiet street away from noise. Staff members are pleasant enough, and while some might find them less chatty than you desire, they are there to help you out at any time. Breakfast is a wide selection and all you need is available. Rooms are modern, clean, have an AC (not a small thing for hot day in Paris!!!) and flat screen with SAT TV. All in all, I will back again, and I recommend it for your stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Pinklady56
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased to have found this hotel. It is very well presented, with polite and excellent staff, in an ideal area for exploring Paris. It is very close, within walking distance, to many of the attractions such as the Louvre, as well as being close to the Opera metro station so making it an ideal location for exploring Paris. The room we had was small but perfect for what we needed. We were on the top floor so had the added extra of having a balcony, which was very pleasant for sitting out for breakfast or in the evening for a drink. The inclusive breakfast was lovely and you have the choice of having it in your room at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly family hotel just in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: Selena H
Reviews.Content: Very friendly Hotel, staff very dedicated and do their best to help us. Nice room and vert clean. Just go out of the Hotel and you can walk to visit best Paris monument and close to the shopping. Just bring a good pair of shoe and you are all set up.

Reviews.Title: “A Warm Welcome to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: LaBimmer
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the staff at the Golden Tulip for a warm welcome and great service. Breakfast was great, staff was friendly and had patience with my small bit of French. Our room was neat and clean and very modern. We were given plenty of information about getting around and had a wonderful time in "Gay Paree! I would certainly stay here again. Thanks again for making our stay a treat. A special shout out to the bartender who made wonderful drinks after a long day of touring.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian hotel That will surprise”
Reviews.Author: bernardjhayes
Reviews.Content: Look all day .You won't find better the feel,style,staff,breakfast in the best location.Settle into Paris the moment you walk though the doors.4 stars at it's best.Opera location make airpot transfer simple for first timers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: NN88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutley fantastic. The staff were lovely, the room we had was incrediable with private balcony, the bed was so comfotable! it was close to all the main tourist sites! Great resturants around. I Would highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “I loved This Hotel!!! One of the best in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: pietro018
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two weeks and to be honest it felt better than being home. The staff was incredible... Especially the reception with Raphael, Christophe, Sasha and Alexandra... This team works every day so your stay can be the best stay ever... Then there is Osman a kind Turkish man that does everything he can to put a smile in your face. I mostly stayed in the hotel during these two weeks, because most of our meeting were conducted in the meeting room at the Opera De Noailles. Adrian is the man who took care of us when we were having our stressful meetings, he is a very charismatic and intelligent man that knows how to treat his clients. My room was amazing everything worked perfectly and it was always clean... All I can say is if you are visiting PARIS, you must stay or at least visit GOLDEN TULIP OPERA DE NOAILLES.... Thank you for everything OPERA DE NOAILLES :)

Reviews.Title: “I Shall Return...”
Reviews.Author: JeffYB
Reviews.Content: The Noailles pleasantly surprised me with the friendly(!) and courteous service. I would be staying over after my business seminar but only on my return from the Sanctuary at Lourdes, a pilgrimage I had promised myself would be the first thing i would do in France. They let me keep my luggage and just come back for it on the weekend of my return. Merci! The building is a pleasant structure with modern if quaint updates. The elevator is a marvel, but will be a tight squeeze since it's shoehorned into the spiral staircase. The room is comfortable, but not large (we had an extra bed). It was tidy and there were enough amenities. Breakfast was continental and quite satisfactory. Price was not cheap, but reasonable for the great location (I got a discount, through the company I work for). And the location alone is well worth many returns! It's smack-dab in the middle of everything, so getting everywhere was never a problem, regardless of the time (we are after all, in the City of Lights). Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quiet little moderately priced boutique hotel at Opera”
Reviews.Author: redvelvetcakeparis
Reviews.Content: The Golden Tulip Noailles is a really good find - tucked away on a queit little street just off the big Opera roundabout. The staff are very friendly and most helpful. The hotel offers contemporary furnishings in a traditional biilding. The rooms are not huge but are well fitted to accommodate everything and the hotel has free wifi. The bathrooms are all superb. Breakfast is a simple but more than adequate continental style wirh attentive staff. I booked through British Airways and got 4 nights for the price of 3 at a much lower rate than the hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable price for a central Paris 4 star Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FRANCES90
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased to find how handy the hotel was for the Metro stations and that we were within walking distance of the Opera House and Madeleine Church. The hotel was very clean, comfortable and staff were really helpful. They allowed us to check- in for our homeward flight on the Reception computer. The Breakfast was tasty and waiting staff most friendly. There was no restaurant but the area is well supplied with all kinds of eating places --Japanese, Thai and Indian as well as French. We only stayed for 7 nights and would definitely return. We slipped up by taking a taxi from Charles De Gaulle Airport on our arrival --cost 67 Euros, but discovered we could get the Airport Bus for our return trip from Place De l'Opera at 10 Euros per person.

Reviews.Title: “Opera De Noailles is my hotel of choice when in Paris, for business or leisure!”
Reviews.Author: rtarallo
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting the Opera De Noailles for many years and my staying has always been memorable. From the courtesy and professionalism of staff (check-in and check-out for returning guests are smooth and efficient), combined with the friendly, personal touch of the owners (providing useful information on things to do while in Paris and... upgrades, when available!); to the fantastic breakfast (offering a good selection of delicious croissants, charcutierie, baguette bread and cafe au lait, among many other sweet and savory French delicacies) and lounging experience (there is a nice bar); availability of French and international press; the comfort, as well as the modern and functional decor of the rooms (those facing the nice courtyard offer an oasis of privacy and relaxation), which make this an ideal destination for business travelers and tourists alike. The bathrooms are contemporary and very spacious, with separate shower and WC rooms, with high quality toiletries and other convenience/amenities (such as robes, complimentary sleepers, etc.). The hotel itself is very centrally located (by Opera Garnier), with easy walking to many landmarks, shopping, restaurants and cafes, as well as convenient access to public transportation (metro, RER, bus and taxi). I have been a welcomed guest at the De Noailles for many years, and I will continue to stay there any time I have an opportunity to visit Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Reagia
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at this hotel during our second honeymoon in Paris. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. The breakfast buffet each morning was superb. I was just expecting some croissant and fruit. They had an assortment of cheese, cold cuts, hard boiled eggs, breads, buns, jams, cereals, fruit salad, pastries, pies, and cakes. If you can’t find something to eat here you are just a very picky eater. Their coffee was amazing, I had the café au lait and cappuccinos. The rooms are small but very clean. The bed was larger than a queen and very comfortable. The location was great. You are a 10 minute walk to the Louvre, a two minute walk to the Opera Square which is where many busses have their end of line and tour buses have their pick up/drop off stops. There are numerous restaurants to choose from. We would definitely recommend this hotel. The best: buffet, cleanliness and location. Least favourite: we were on the 6th floor so we had to use the elevator. Thank goodness it was a quick elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Small cute hotel with small but awesomely furbished rooms”
Reviews.Author: Frankylicious
Reviews.Content: We spend our birthday in this lovely hotel and we just fully satisfied. The rooms might be small but hey it's central Paris and a great location just 5-10 minutes walk from the Louvre! The fact that the hotel is small and has not too many rooms actually creates a very nice intimate atmosphere. The rooms are elegantly furbished, the shower is just awesome. The breakfast was amazing and just a perfect start to the day. Staff was very helpful and very nice. I will definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay here”
Reviews.Author: MustangJoe
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed last years trip to Paris so much that we decided to visit again this year. We chose to stay at the same hotel as our last trip, the Opera de Noailles, since we had such a good experience last year. I'm pleased to say that we enjoyed this years stay just as much. We ended up in room 606 which has a very small balcony overlooking the interior courtyard. The room was small but clean and modern. It was also very quiet since it was away from the street and on the top floor. We really like the location of the hotel. It's close to many restaurants and the Opera station making it a convenient place to hop on the Metro. The staff have always been pleasant and helpful and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “SHOCKED at the lack of service!”
Reviews.Author: trf1968
Reviews.Content: My wife and our two young children stayed here for three nights on our first trip to Paris. We had just come from London on a long vacation, and as a result had several pieces of luggage and lots of other stuff that a family gathers when traveling with small children. The hotel itself is ok -- albeit VERY small rooms compared to what we in the US are used to. It is located on a really small and narrow street and the taxi van had a hard time unloading our luggage, as he was blocking the entire one lane road. Check in was fine. The staff did indeed politely help us with the internet connection (which is somewhat unwieldy). Families should be aware however that there is no real room service at this hotel. Our kids like to eat what kids typically eat, and we also have a severe allergy in the family to a certain ingredient in food, and the hotel front desk attendant told us there was no way to order anything special as the hotel has no kitchen and just brings food in from surrounding restaurants. That was annoying, but not a deal breaker. The biggest and most shocking problem came at checkout. First, they were extremely aggressive in making us check out at noon -- a hotel employee literally chased us out into the street as we were heading to breakfast on the morning we were due to check out and flagged us down over a block away from the hotel to rudely remind us that we MUST be out by noon. Next, we were traveling back to London by train and needed a large taxi (probably mini-van) to take us to the train station after check out as four of us and five bags were not going to fit into a small taxi. I spoke to the hotel front desk at 7:00 am -- and was told that they would gladly book some outside car service to pick us up that afternoon at 3:30 so we could make our 5:00 train. A few minutes later they called back and told me that they could not get any car booked in advance and we would instead have to be back at the hotel about 15 minutes before the time we wanted to leave and they would call a taxi for us then. I didn't like the sound of that but I was repeatedly assured that this was NOT a problem. We returned to the hotel after lunch and made sure we were there by 3:00. When I walked in, they would not answer my questions about the cab, and instead insisted I pay the bill, which exceeded 2,000 Euros (thus this is not a cheap hotel). I did so. The woman at the front desk then told us to wait in the lobby and she would call the taxi. After about 20-30 minutes she casually walked over to us and said, "Its Impossible. I have called two companies and there are no cabs." I was stunned and VERY angry. I asked her what she suggested we do with our young children and our luggage and our non-refundable, non-changeable train tickets. Her response was to that we should all walk to the area near the opera (which was three blocks away) and flag down a cab for ourselves! I told her that was unacceptable, as we had found it nearly impossible to get a cab at all during our four days in Paris. She could not have cared less. It seemed quite apparent that since we had paid our bill, she was done providing us with any type of reasonable service. I have travelled pretty much around the world and have never gotten such horrible service at the most critical time in a trip -- to leave us with our kids and luggage just stranded in Paris with the clock ticking on our train tickets was a complete disgrace! There are many, many hotels in this area that all seem just as nice if not nicer than this hotel, and I suggest that if you are going to Paris for your first trip, or with a family, or if you need anything other than a closet sized hotel room with no view, then you should pick somewhere else to stay. This place is a JOKE.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: wintertired
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to Paris, France, from May 26, 2011 to June 3, 2011. While in Paris we stayed at the Hotel Opera de Noailles. This is not a large hotel which suited us just fine. We had a non smoking room on the top floor which overlooked the centre courtyard. The hotel has been totally redecorated and very tastefully done. The bathroom was a good size, there was lots of closet space, there was a/c , and the beds were very comfortable. The staff at the hotel could not do enough for you. They have free internet, and help you with that as well. The buffet breakfast was extensive and kept well stocked. This hotel is also in a very good area, and suitable for anyone at any age.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in this part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Val2300
Reviews.Content: This is one of the newer, better hotels in this area of Paris which is near the financial/business district (the stock exchange is nearby). The room and bath were clean and well maintained, water pressure was good. Though like many hotels in Paris, the room is small. It was a solo trip (partly for business reasons) so this wasn't a problem. Front desk and other staff were polite and helpful, especially the young lady who helped with my internet connection. Not all the staff speak English but she's great. There are a number of Japanese/Korean restaurants within a 5-minute walk from the hotel. These seem to be the only places open during the weekend. So other than it being a little quiet during the weekend, the location is fine if one needs (or likes) to be in this part of Paris. Otherwise, a hotel of similar standard on the left bank might have made a better choice for a holiday in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rvanfleet
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I loved this hotel for many reasons. First, we got a great rate online and paid in full ahead of time. We request a room with a balcony and got room 602. It had a HUGE veranda! Every night we had a wine and cheese party for two. The room was very nice with a good air conditioner. Be aware though, this room does not allow for a lot of privacy. The tub and shower are in the main room with the toilet in a little phone booth style area off to the side. There are lots of cafes and bakeries on the street to get fresh breakfast goodies and coffees. We loved this hotel for many reasons including the free internet, the friendly staff, and the location. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends and family looking for a great deal and and wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Safe hotel in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: Celina-fll
Reviews.Content: For the first time I was alone in Paris and not sure of myself. I decided to go back to the Golden Tulip Opera de Noailles and it was my best choice. very safe for a woman alone and close to the activity. I recommend without any problem

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced”
Reviews.Author: frenchderek
Reviews.Content: In April 1961 we stayed at the Hotel de Noailles, Paris, on our honeymoon. We were there again, 50 years later to celebrate still being together. It's classier now - high quality fittings, much friendlier and helpful staff. But, the bedroom was a tight fit. The bar closes at 10 pm. When we returned from a concert at about 11 pm, hoping for a night-cap, we had to wait for the night porter to let us into the hotel and then explain the bar was closed. Breakfast was OK: good quality preserves but poor quality (for Paris) baguettes. We've stayed at 3-star hotels in Pais with as good (or better facilities) at half the price. (And I've stayed at several Tulip hotels better and cheaper).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Trouka
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly staff, clean room, comfortable bed, but somewhat expensive for such a small room.

Reviews.Title: “very clean & comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: stu-nodd-cuzin
Reviews.Content: The Golden Tulip is truly golden, very clean, helpful staff, and good breakfast. Rooms are small , bathroom smaller, great shower. No clocks and only one TV station in English, British Euro News that repeated the same news over and over again. Near Opera, Monoprix (French Target) and Metro. Great biscut shop on Rue de Opera , La Cure Gourmande expensive but worth it. Two great restaurants on bd des Italiens Grand B 24 bd des Italiens and Nouro across the street 29 bd des Italiens.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noo-Noo-Nine Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was close to the Roissy Bus stop from the airport - meaning no Metro travel with suitcases. Very pleasantly surprised with the modern look of the hotel with quirky sculptures and lovely clean public areas. Our room was a Superior Double and reasonably 'big' by Paris standards. Very clean again, big bed, nice bathroom with good toiletries. Our friends' room was quite different - still very new and modern but a large Japanese style bed ie on the floor that took up all the space between the two walls! And a glass screened bathroom. So check what type of room you are getting if you're not sure on this style. Breakfast - great choice and luckily included in our room rate otherwise 18 euros!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - great location friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ZoeThatcher
Reviews.Content: I had a long weekend at this hotel and i would strongly recommend it. The staff were so helpful they made getting around and seeing everything Paris had to offer so simple. The hotel is a great location with easy access to all the sights and walking distance to the Louvre and many restaurants and bars. The rooms were really modern and clean. Lovely breakfast and bar as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for a trip in Paris”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonianGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a solo trip to Paris. The hotel is very cool and is a very good value for the price. They may have had a breakfast, but I never got up in time to eat it. Perfect location...in the center of the city in very safe location. The shower rules too.

Reviews.Title: “Opera de Noailles defines exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: alixed
Reviews.Content: I spent my birthday at Opera de Noailles. It will go down as one of the most memorable birthdays. The hotel is in one of the most beautiful neighbourhoods on a romantic little winding street. The staff at the hotel really know how to create the most memorable customer experience. They are ready to attend to your every need in such a cheerful way. Our room was so romantic. We had a huge terrace that looked out onto the amazing Paris skyline. I felt like we were on a movie set. The breakfast included in the price was so scrumptious. I couldn't wait to go down for breakfast -- and I'm not a morning person. You must check out La Fontaine Gaillon (owned by actor Gerard Depardieu) for their seafood. It's just a few doors down from the hotel. Dinner runs around $200 euros but it's worth every euro. La Grand Cafe is also worth the visit. I can't wait to go back to Paris and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As Paris should be!”
Reviews.Author: Surph
Reviews.Content: Small enough, but providing the kind of service you like, this is a very well located, classy and up-to-date hotel. Free wifi which is important to me. Close to shopping and business area. And decently priced!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect value, standards and location”
Reviews.Author: Idefourny
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal on British Airlines and booked 2 rooms as I needed to be in Paris 5 days for work and invited my parents for the weekend. The only mishap was the first morning when my breakfast order was still hanging on the door... Other than that we had an unfortunate timing with some work on the only lift and being on the fifth floor - but nevertheless my 5 day stay was great and working in the hospitality industry myself I know what I'm talking about!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable room, excellent location.....watch out for the snail in the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: blairmacd75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights just prior to Christmas. We had a suite per couple which offered us a little more room. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The rain shower, albeit part of the toilet space (a little unusual/quirky in design) was sensational particularly after a long flight or a day walking the Paris streets in the snow! The location is superb being located about a 2 minute walk from the Opera Metro station. It is an ideal base to discover Paris and in warmer weather none of the major tourist destinations would be too far to walk to. The staff are welcoming and helpful and speak very good English. The room service was a little slow and not of such a good standard, however, I do not think they cater in house for this. The only criticism would be the lack of tea/coffee facilities in the rooms. Very interesting artworks and a very comfortable base from which to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and big enough rooms”
Reviews.Author: _illy197
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an ideal location for shopping and museums, its also situated near transport hubs, you even have a bus stop for an airport bus. Free wi-fi, big enough rooms and friendly staff. Breakfast is too light and rates are slightly overrated.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: panch
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at this hotel. The room was small, but practical. The bathroom is updated modern. The mattress is firm and not bouncy. Breakfast had a great selection. The location can't be beat. Just steps away from the Opera, and access to majot metro lines. So getting around is easy. The staff was very helpful and good with directions. I would definately go back. The best place you can stay for price and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel, poor staff”
Reviews.Author: 9gc
Reviews.Content: I visited the Hotel Opera De Noailles during a trip to Paris in March and wanted to find hotel in the centre of Paris which was affordable for a three day visit. I came across the hotel using Trip Advisor and was delighted with the choice. Right in the centre of the Opera district with a two minute walk from a major Metro Station. Quaint little hotel, rooms are very small but perfect for what I needed. Frosted glass partition between the bedroom and bathroom which I thought added a nice touch. The only negative from the trip was we arrived late back to the hotel on our second night staying there and ordered room service. After waiting over 1 hour and 30 minutes we had to go down to reception at 1.00am to ask where our food was. We were advised that all room service food was "out sourced". When the food eventually arrived it was the incorrect food to what we had ordered. The following morning we complained to the staff on receiption and to be frank, their customer service was terrible and they literally blamed us for ordering the food so late. Overall excellent location, good hotel but the staff really need to learn some customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: kerrye27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during my first trip to Paris. What a great place! It's small, but has style. It's clean and the staff is friendly. We were able to meet every morning over a light, but substantial breakfast. It is within walking distance of the Louvre, Opera de Garnier and umpteen restaurants and shops. My sixth floor room is quaint, but has everything I need ... including a cute little patio overlooking the Rue de la Mochidiere. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Clarioner1966
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my two teenage sons in the October half-term for 3 nights... this was our cultural break. This hotel is first-class for a Paris city hotel, the staff are very helpful and friendly and multi-lingual. The hotel is located in a side street very close to the Opera area, which is like the West End of London - there are cinemas, theatres and opera houses everywhere, it's quite up-market (and quite expensive, but so is all of Paris). There are two main bouelvards within 10 minutes walk with probably 30-40 restaurants. You can walk to most attractions and Paris is quite a poretty city. Louvre, River, you could do the Arc De triumph and Champs Elysees, but it would be about 25-20 minutes. The metro is the best way to get aorund, very frequent and quite clean. You can buy day passes or books of 10 tickets. A single tick is about €1.70 or a book of 10 for €12. You use a ticket per trip - each way (so 2 tickets per return journey). If you fly, goto Orly airport, it's nearer and a taxi from ther eic heaper than the train and easier (about €30). The hotel rooms are very clean, modern and have air-con. The hotel has a small bar, and breakfast area, the breakfast choice is good. We booked thorugh Octopus Travel who had a deal on, and paid around £165 per night B&B for a triple room... the hotel's own rack-rate is more like €300 per night. There is shopping close by at La Rafayette which is a bit like Harrods (and similar price). If you want ot eat more cheaply, get on a ube for about 15 mins to the Latin Quarter, aorund the St Michael tube stop, it;s more like Soho there. Hope this help someone!

Reviews.Title: “Good all rounder”
Reviews.Author: 186338Anne
Reviews.Content: Room 9, nice and quiet, clean, excellent breakfast. Good location and pleasant staff. AM Sep 2010

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly noisy given the price”
Reviews.Author: d0gwalker
Reviews.Content: It's a good-looking hotel: it has funky day-glo statues of bears and a snail in its lobby, there are contemporary artworks here and there, and my bedroom had hip, brown leather-panelled walls. Plus the bars of soap in the bathroom are black. But I got the sense that the high-gloss finish didn't go all the way through; this is an old hotel that has had a cool makeover. The bed in my room had a saggy mattress, and worst of all was the noise coming from an adjacent room where I could hear every footstep, the phone ringing and so on - loud enough to wake me up at night and then again in the morning. Plus even though my room was on the 4th floor I could easily hear the Metro trains rumbling under the building, late into the night and again early the next day. Given it's not cheap - my company paid €375 for one night, plus €15 for breakfast - I would have hoped for a better night's sleep. One final, positive point: the hotel has free Wi-Fi. But the connection was a little temperamental on my iPhone (I had to turn it off and back on again to get it to use the connection).

Reviews.Title: “Great location but our room is small.”
Reviews.Author: Imee1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with British Airways. We stayed for five nights (October 1-6). Breakfast is included. The hotel staff are pleasant and helpful and spoke English which is helpful when traveling in France. Hotel is clean. For breakfast you have cold meats, cereals, toast, croissants, pain au chocolat, sliced fresh fruits, creme fraiche, orange juice, Evian water, coffee, tea, espresso. We like the location of this hotel. Walking distance to Opera House, Metro stations, many restaurants, cinemas, shops. By the way, if you want to watch a movie in English you look for a movie which says 'VO' (version original) We stayed in Room 305 (close to elevator). Modern furnishing. It has closets, drawers, small safe. Our bedroom is small. The toilet and shower is very close to the bed. There is a lot of water when you step out of the shower. Free Wi-Fi in bedroom. Ask front desk for pass code. Free Wi-Fi in lobby area. The elevator is tiny - just enough for two people with two medium size luggage. I recommend Restaurant La Fontaine Gaillon which is less than five minutes from this hotel. We spent 144,00 Euros for dinner for two people. Our Main course - 34,00 Euros (Blanc de St-Pierre aux Artichauts) and 38,00 Euros (Filet de Bar Roti aux Aperges Vertes); bottle of wine (Chateau de Tigne Les Maillones); Dessert - 14,00 Euros (Feuillantine aux Poires Caramelisees) and 14,00 Euros (Profiteroles au Chocolat Chaud). There is a couple of Japanese restaurants next to the hotel. And many more Japanese restaurants about two blocks away. The closest Chinese/Vietnamese restaurant to this hotel is La Tour De Jade on Rue de la Michodiere. In my opinion, this hotel is a three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with perfect room upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Shaun28
Reviews.Content: Hi, My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights during August. I have stayed in a few hotels over the years and never felt the need to write a review, but this stay was special for a couple of reasons. 1) Location: The hotel is in an excellent location. You can walk almost anywhere in Paris from here, even to the Eiffel Tower. There are loads of shops, restaurants and bars nearby. Transport links to go further or just avoid walking are all nearby also so it is a great base for exploring both cultural and social places. 2) Room: This is where we may have just got lucky. When we arrived on Friday we were assigned a normal Paris room - small and functional. However we chanced our arm on Saturday morning and asked for a free upgrade with street view balcony. The room we got was amazing with bath for two in the bedroom just a few meters from the bed and a large 'double' balcony. Sitting there in the evening with a bottle of wine after walking around Paris was the perfect end to a day. A special thank you must go to Adrian who works there, gave us the room and was really nice to us all weekend. Even without the room upgrade it is a great little hotel and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Value - Priceless Location”
Reviews.Author: BEmo24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Paris for my fist visit in the City of Light last June. We got to stay at the Golden Tulip Opera de Noailles and our experience was superb. The front dest staff were very polite and helpful. They politely answered all our requests with promptness and friendliness. The room was small but very clean and it offered everything we needed and was decorated with style. We enjoyed the amazing breakfast that was so varied and complete that it sustained us until late afternoon. It was really sweet to hear the buffet staff greet us in the morning. It was like some scene that we often see in movies : bonjour Monsieur-Dame ! The hotel location was perfect. So much so indeed that we walked our way to most of the sites we wanted to visit. When indeed we took the metro, climbing up the stairs to see the breathtaking view of Opera Garnier made our stay that much more memorable. We would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms great location”
Reviews.Author: dbbremner
Reviews.Content: Once you get over the tiny rooms and bathrooms cut into the side of the room it is not too bad. Location great, don't have a drink in the hotel, bar man tried to charge up 40Euros for 2 beers and 2 wines. When he was challenged accused us having a couple of whiskys despite the beers still lying on the table in front of us ! Overall not bad but rooms too small and not overly friendly!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel - I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: SDSPhotographycouk
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner visited Paris earlier this year. This hotel really was brilliant. - Great trendy rooms - Gorgeous shower - Really nice breakfast included in our price - Really friendly staff - Central/Prime location I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Check-out time is early.”
Reviews.Author: SKCTokyo
Reviews.Content: The property: I intensely dislike mid-priced Paris hotels. The rooms are usually small, sparsely furnished, and invariably, frayed. However, this hotel is not bad. That is, if you don’t mind the toilet being two meters from the nearest pillow. The balcony we had was quite nice. And the art in the public spaces is unusual, and not lacking for a sense of humor. The location: Near the Passages and the Opera. A bit noisy. I’m not crazy about staying in this area; there are more interesting areas elsewhere in Paris. The breakfast was outstanding. One of the best I’ve had in Europe. Hotel gripes: 1 – We went out early for a walkabout on our last day; a hotel guy followed us out to ask what time we were checking out. It started to rain, so we came back. We went to our room at about 10:30, the door was open, and the room was being cleaned. We sat down in full view of the cleaning person, who ignored us. After half an hour we had to interrupt her and tell her that we were still using the room. She didn’t speak English, and apologized. Naturally, after all her hard work, we tiptoed around and did not use the room as we might have for fear of messing it up. So, we left early for the airport. Some guy in charge said it was a mix up, but it seemed like the “Oops, we didn’t know” bum’s rush con game. Next time I’m going to pay the money for a better Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: 1adklady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights recently and found the quiet location to be ideal. We never used any public transportation except when we went to Normandy and Versailles. It took us about 45 minutes to walk to the Eiffel Tower, but we loved walking all around the city. Montmartre, The Louvre, Orsay, Arc De Triomphe, Napolean's Tomb, etc., are very close to the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our booking included breakfast and we felt what was served in the morning was quite sufficient. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again. Our Paris Shuttle to the airport was very late picking us up and they spoke with the company for us and the shuttle arrived within 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fabolous location”
Reviews.Author: Gyzels
Reviews.Content: As the location was a priority for us, this hotel has a fabolous location in a small quiet street: every top attraction in Paris is within walking distance. Also 2 metro lines are nearby. The rooms are small but with all comfort (airco, fridge, TV, design shower!, good bed). With nice weather, you can take the breakfast outside in a small garden (5 tables). Nice! The hotel has no parking, but the reception will lead you to a payable parking within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MustangJoe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 25th anniversary in Paris and the Noailles was recommended by our travel agent. We booked it after reading the reviews here on TA and we were not disappointed. The location is excellent - close to the Opera station and a short walk to the Louvre and Place Vendome and many nearby restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My pitiful French skills were never a problem as all of the staff that I encountered were able to speak English. We stayed in room 610, a small room on the top floor at the very back of the hotel. The room was very quiet with an unobtrusive A/C system and a very comfortable bed. We slept better there than at home! The room has a very modern, funky feel with a black tiled shower, glass panel walls for the toilet and bright red accents for the furniture and comforter. The funkiness continues in the lobby with large orange plastic bears and snails scattered around. Our room included breakfast which was served from 7:30 to 11 every morning and we enjoyed the selection of pastries, cold cuts, cheeses and cereals. I really can't think of anything that I would have changed and I would definitely stay there again if given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Opera de Noailles etait magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: CanadiansInParis
Reviews.Content: We recently came back from our first European vacation in celebration of our 10yr anniversary. Having spent some time online researching various hotels, we selected Hotel Opera de Noailles. And what an experience we had. Centrally located, it was easy to hop on/off a number of different direct metro lines to the places we wanted to see; and of course, prime shopping at our door steps. I was a little worried about the hotel offering only a cold buffet breakfast but the selection and quality of food was outstanding = quality, fresh, and a good variety. The staff was always pleasant (especially at the front desk and the ladies at breakfast - who at times seemed stunned that, like a true CDN, asked them how they were that day) and the atmosphere at the hotel was polished but welcoming. A great fantastic first experience - thank you everyone. We only wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “"Angels in Paris"”
Reviews.Author: lesliebouchard
Reviews.Content: This year my husband and I decided to go to Paris. He booked our trip back in December of 2009 for May of 2010. We booked first class for a treat and I picked out this hotel for it's reviews and location. When we left Canada, we were so excited to get to Paris. When we arrived at the hotel, they told us that the agency that had booked our package with had cancelled our hotel reservations. The hotel even called them when they received the cancellation to make sure and were told yes.(Strange that we had 1st class airline tickets to France with no hotel room). Anyway, with no sleep and arriving at 9.30 am on a Saturday in Paris, we could do absolutely nothing until the agency in Canada opened up 6 hours later. The staff at the hotel took us in, locked up our baggage for us, offered us breakfast and let us sit in the lounge area. They could have said " We are sorry and can"t do anything for you", You have to leave, but they didn't! We waited until the agency opened in Canada and were told that there had been a glitch made in the computer system cancelling our hotel. They would try to find us another 4 star hotel in Paris. We waited and waited and waited, they couldn't re-book at this hotel because they were full. They couldn't find anything else either in the area. By 8 o'clock that night, we were still sitting in the lounge area of this hotel with nothing from the agency. We hadn't eaten because we didn't want to miss a telephone call from the agency. By this time, I was so exhausted that I started to cry! (Which I never do). Luckily for me a staff member contacted the Hotel Manager from the Golden tulip Opera de Noailles on a Saturday. She came by and tried to console me(us). She said that they had no room that night but maybe could try to do something on Monday when things opened up. She hugged me and told me not to worry. In the meantime the agency called the hotel and asked to speak to my husband. They had finally found us another 4 star hotel in another part of Paris for 3 nights. We took a cab over there. Now when you compare apples to apples it should be the same! This other 4 star hotel (you would think would be almost the same) was a dump and I mean a dump! There were no places nearby to eat and on top of that, I told my husband never mind, let's just go to the bar and have a drink. Trying to relax sipping on a beer (it's now 11.00pm in Paris), what do I see running across the floor: a mouse, a rat , call it what you want! When I told the worker there about it, he just shrugged! We tried to sleep, with all of our clothes on, on top of the bed, because it was so dirty, but of course sleep alluded us! We got up first thing in the morning and we decided to go back to the hotel Golden Tulip Opera de Noailles to maybe get lucky and be able to sleep there (even if it was on a Sunday). There was no way I was staying at that other hotel regardless of whether or not they could take us! We went back and luckily for us, they could fit us in for at least the next 9 days of our trip. We were told that on the last 2 days they were fully booked and that we would probably have to move again, but they told me that the Manager would be in tomorrow and would try to take care of us! We were so relieved! They showed us our room, which was a dream! Clean, a marble bathroom, Zenly decorated with a garden in the middle of the building when we looked down from our windows (that opened). After showering, my husband and I passed out until around 8.00 pm that day! We never heard a sound while sleeping all afternoon either. On Monday the Manager and her assistant came to see us at Breakfast, hugged us and told me that they had arranged it with the agency to be able to keep us for the whole next 12 days of our stay! What angels, I have never seen service above and beyond the call of duty as I have with the people at this hotel! On top of it, about 1 week into our stay, I realized that the Manager and her staff had upgraded our original room from a standard to a Deluxe without telling us and doing it without having to! The whole time we were guests at this hotel, the staff called restaurants to make reservations for us, the Management suggested the best places to go to, for what we were looking for, they booked sight seeing tours for us and again, everyone from the cleaning ladies, to the waiters, to the desk clerks up to Mangaement were so polite and helpful that we felt truly special! I know for a fact that our trip was a wonderful experience because of them! I will go back to Paris next year with my adult daughter and I will definately be staying at the Golen Tulip Opera de Noailles! They say it is a 4 star but compared to the other 4 star hotels in Paris, for us it is a 20 star hotel! Sincerely, Leslie

Reviews.Title: “A home in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: zinho007
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers you an exciting mixture of a charming interior and warm atmosphere to make you feel at home. Already when we entered in the hall, we were received as part of the family of this excellent house. The hotel has an ideal situation to discover the best of Paris in a footwalking distance (Opera 1 min, Sacre Coeur in 15 min, Louvre 5 min, Chatelet in 15 min). The rooms are decorated with a very personal touch in a combination of modern meets cosiness. Thumbs up - definetively not the last time that we took it. A big thank you to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located Small but with a modern twist Hotel! Absolutely stunning!”
Reviews.Author: LondonliLmadam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here February 28th - 3rd March 2009 with my mother, sister and brother. I must say the Golden Tulip chain has a reputation for being a top class hotel, and this trip proved just that! Situated down a small narrow road, the Golden Tulip is a hidden gem, opposite is a Gym (for all you fitness fanatics), and a couple of cafes surrounding it. Entering the hotel, the reception are more than friendly, spoke perfect english, and allocated us to ur rooms. There is only one lift and is really small, maximum 2 people, but there were also stairs that spiralled upwards. When located to our rooms (we booked two rooms), we found that we had in fact been place opposite each other (perfect!), which also had a door with a lock in the hallway which seperated our rooms to the rest of the other rooms on the floor (even more perfect as we didnt have to keep our bedroom doors locked, we could just go in and out of each others rooms lol!) Both rooms consisted of twins beds, dressing table, built-in closet and a flat screen wall mounted TV. Plenty of space for two people - 3 would definetly be a tight squeeze! The decor was modern, keeping neutral colours: cream/grey. The bathroom had to be the most perfect thing about the rooms, built with glass doors surrounding it (of course not seethrough lol), with one room having a HUGE walk-in shower, and the other having a bath tub! Everything was centrally located, so and central station was a 3 minute walk away! The tube stations are pretty simple to get your head around (like London's) and workers were more than friendly! There are a number of internet cafes around the Hotel, also the Hotel provided Wi-Fi for a fee, I think based on hourly rates (can't quite remember!) This is the perfect hotel for those on their honeymoon, couples and families. Those who are into fine dining and top notch hotel service, this hotel is definetly for you! Perfect way to spend my 20th Birthday! Would I visit again? MOST DEF!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NorwegianTraveler1
Reviews.Content: This is a newly upgraded hotel. The design in the rooms as well as the rest of the hotel is really good. We were met with smiles at check in, and a "to do list" for tourists in Paris. During the whole stay the reception staff was quick, friendly and really service minded. The location is perfect. Walking distance to several top sights, and with the metro just a couple of meters away. I would recommend this hotel for both business and leisure. Beware if you are traveling with a friend, and not a partner, that the bathroom walls are made of tinted glass which are very much see through. And the AC in the room sounds like an airplane, so light sleepers beware. Overall we were very happy with this hotel, and we are most definitely staying here for our next visit to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lsunnari
Reviews.Content: I have travelled the world and stayed at some good and some bad hotels. Golden Tulip Opera de Noailles is a very good hotel. The location is perfect, risht next to the Opera with walking distances to everything and the tourist opean air busses just around the courner! The staff are very polite ( yes there is a myth that french people dont want to speak english and that they are rude, this is not the case here) and villling to help you get the best out of your holiday and Paris. The rooms are clean and tastefully designed. I absolutely love their bathrooms; both bath and shower (normal and waterfall showerheads).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location let down by lack of facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Brittus
