Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in this hotel. The location is perfect - within 5 minutes walk of The Louvre, and 10 minutes walk to the Galleries Lafayette (shopping centre). The Eiffel Tower and Mon Matre area are longer distances away - about 30-40 minute walk. The rooms are small, but clean and well thought out. The air conditioning works well, and we had four great night's sleep; despite the central location, the hotel is quiet. However, that pretty much sums up the hotel's entire offering - a quiet place to sleep. There is no atmosphere in the hotel at all, and this means that if, like us, you see the hotel as part of your holiday (rather than simply a room with a bed in) you're going to be disappointed - especially when the rate on the door is over £250 per night for a standard room. There is no hotel restaurant, so don't expect to eat in here. You can get breakfast for an extra £15 per head, which is hugely expensive and not worth it - cereals, fruit, croissants, etc. The hotel bar is tiny, only open until 10pm and possibly the most expensive we've ever seen - a Jack Daniels & Coke, and a Whiskey & water cost a staggering £30. The staff are helpful, professional and friendly - but given they've got nothing to do other than hand out room keys, they must also be incredibly bored. This is a hotel that is completely missing a trick - whether by design, or not. In summary, this hotel is perfect if you just want somewhere to shower and sleep - but if so, you can get far better rates in Paris than those offered here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and customer service”
Reviews.Author: yloca
Reviews.Content: A great location: supermarket, pharmacy, restaurants, and coffee shops, a helpful staff, not to quiet, but in general is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: silberlu
Reviews.Content: In the end of February I satyed there with my husband and our one year old baby during 5 days. We simply loved the hotel, very friendly staff, perfect location and tasty breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service in a really convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kla_Scotland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the De Noialles for 3 nights to celebrate my mum's 60th birthday. The location is great - just round the corner from the Galleries Lafayette and a 10 minute walk to the Louvre Gallery. The Opera Metro station is less than 3 minutes walk away. We were amazed at how quiet the hotel seems in comparisson to the bustling streets outside. Our room was great. A little small perhaps, but we expected that in Paris. There was certainly very little floor space, but the furniture was stylish and comfortable - fine for 2 people. Our room overlooked the central atrium garden which was very pleasant and meant that we heard no traffic noise at all. We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet - plenty of choice - and friendly staff kept everything topped up. The thing that really impressed me about the De Noialles was the staff. Everyone we met was really friendly and helpful - they remembered my mum's birthday, and greeted us by name everytime we came in and out of the hotel. I've stayed in many hotels, and the service here was the best I've encountered in a long time. Thanks very much - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RussGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days in this Paris hotel in August 2008. Location - nice, very center of Paris and everything is near. First room that hotel staff gave us....was tiny room on the second floor and with terrible smell - looked as 2 month in that room lived 5 cats and dogs. In my correspondence with the hotel staff they garanty upper floor room with terrace (602) which was recomended to me by my friends.... When I told this to the guy on the reception he told me that he doesnt know nothing and to all russians they gave this room.... Sorry, I am not all...I call to the hotel manager, show to the guy from reception the correspondence with manager, and they told me that they give me room 602 in few hours and now we could hold bags and go to working. The room 602 was really good - upper-floor, good view, terrace and comfortable bed. We were happy. Breakfast was very simple for 4* hotel, but good.

Reviews.Title: “The third bed of a triple room is a fold out bed”
Reviews.Author: LondonYoyo78 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother and husband. The third bed of the triple room was a fold out bed and the room was very small. The bathroom walls consisted of frosted glass. Not a good place to share with people other than your partner. Apart from that it was a nice hotel but a bit over priced

Reviews.Title: “One of our favourite Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dorisoxon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. The room was very comfortable and new/y reburbished. It is close to the Metro at Place de l'Opera.. The breakfasts were substantial and interesting. All the staff, without question, were most helpful and friendly. There are many restaurants within walking distance ranging from Pizza Houses to first class, gourmet restaurants. I can recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: VanCanuck2010
Reviews.Content: The Golden Tulip Opera de Noailles is a small boutique hotel located close to tourist sites. The hotel is within 2 blocks of the Metro and an Internet Cafe as well as shopping and restaurants. Our room was extremely small - in fact, barely enough space to open our suitcases - but this is typical of Paris hotel rooms. The decor was modern but appeared to be more worn than indicated in the pictures. However, the rooms were clean and sufficient. The only complaints I have are regarding service at the hotel. For example, we had some problems with our bathtub not draining properly. Although I asked that the drain be fixed, during the 4 days we stayed at the hotel, it never was. Overall, the hotel offers good value for money as long as you are paying a 3-star room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a great area for a great value”
Reviews.Author: strobellayjam
Reviews.Content: (It's taken a while for me to get to writing a review on this great hotel but figured better late than never!) This was our 3rd time back in Paris but first time at the Golden Tulip. We selected it based on its proximity to the Metro and previous reviews from Trip Advisor. Our room was located on the 5th floor, had a shower stall (requested by us as we do not like baths), and a view of the courtyard. Breakfast was also included. Brief summary: Rooms - Small but this wasn't a major concern since we didn't spend much time here. They were very clean and that was all that mattered to us. Breakfast - decent selection of breads, pastries, cheeses, meats, and fruit Service - no problems here. The staff were polite and courteous. Location - MOST EXCELLENT! The metro was a stone throw's away and we felt comfortable strolling the neighbourhood at night. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby. Very close (10 minute walk) to the Louvre and Jardin des Tulieries. I'd return again.

Reviews.Title: “I Heart Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ilovedgreece
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July 2007 and loved it! This little boutique hotel was in the perfect location, very close to the Opera house and more importantly a Starbucks! We were able to walk to the Louvre and were easily able to hop on those double-decker tour buses to get us around town (highly recommend doing this) as well as the Metro. The hotel itself is quite small but lovely. The breakfast (especially the cheese, meats and breads) were fabulous. The room was a good size for two people. My only concern was the bathroom- it looked like it had just been renovated to look very modern except it was not practical. On more than one occasion, we had to call up someone from reception to take a look at the shower because water was going everywhere!! Only other thing that I remember was that sometimes the air conditioning was sketchy (only sometimes) and my international converter/plug did not work. There were plenty of places to eat around the area although I was not very impressed with the food at all! Was looking for a more authentic French cuisine but did not find it in the area… Only other good thing was that there was an internet café nearby (although they may offer internet now who knows!) All in all, I loved this place. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Staff Could Improve”
Reviews.Author: travelchicusa
Reviews.Content: The location is great, about 10 minutes by taxi to Louvre or Eiffel Tower and walking distance to shops and restaurants. The staff could have been more helpful with recommendations, etc. If breakfast is NOT included in the price of your room, it's not worth 15 euro per person, as you could get more for your money outside of the hotel. Also, you must pay for internet access, $10 euro for 60 minutes or 17 euro for 24 hours, which surprised me because I went all over Greece, Italy, and France and this is the only hotel the made guests pay additionally for it. They need to get with the times on that one. Overall, the location was my favorite aspect of this hotel; however, if you want to be within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and major shopping area, stay at Hotel Biltmore instead, which is part of accorhotels group. Enjoy! Paris was the highlight of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCookie
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. We found it to be comfortable, clean and very conveniently located. You are a minute or two from two Metro lines. The Opera station has a number of lines that are handy for getting around Paris when you need to transfer to other lines. The beds and pillows were very firm and comfortable. And with the heat we truly appreciated the air conditioning. You are also within walking distance of a number of different restaurants and the Galleries Layfattete, a major (expensive) department store. Plus the breakfast was excellent with an assortment of fruits, yogurts, baked goods, cheese, meats and cereals offered.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Travelisliving
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our option with a BA Holidays package. Great location within walking distance of shopping and the Lourve. Excellent staff. Our package included a continental breakfast of cereal, juices, croissants, fruit and cheeses. Yummy! We also travelled with a 2 year old for which they supplied an extra cot. Highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: angelo65Geneva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights in Paris for businness.Location is great especially for tourists.Staff were friendly and helpful.My room was on the courtyard side so very quiet.Not very big and furniture was slightly rundown.The rooms and bathroom are kept spotlessly clean.I found the bed much too soft and not comfortable to my standards.If you want an upper middle class hotel at a reasonable price and well located this is your hotel.I will definetely return.Starbucks is just round the corner for a good morning coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: windy46
Reviews.Content: On a quiet street in a neighborhood convenient to shopping, the Metro, the Opera and the Louvre, lies a gem of a hotel, the Golden Tulip Opera de Noailles. The rooms are stylishly modern with every convenience; the beds extremely comfortable. We were lucky enough to receive an upgrade to a suite with private terrace and couldn't have been more pleased. The staff was always friendly and helpful during our 4 night stay. The buffet continental breakfast was excellent and a good value for the money. We will make this our hotel whenever we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Canada2009_9
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and at first it looked like a small "hole in the wall" but we were just not used to Paris hotels! The rooms, staff, service-everything-was amazing! The location, near the Opera, was excellent - lots of restaurants and cafes nearby and a 10-minute walk to the Louvre and the Seine. Very quiet at night and the rooms are beautiully updated! The breakfast is varied and the service overall was exceptional. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: will33_9
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as our base for a four day trip to Paris. The location was perfect. The hop on hop off bus stops were just three blocks away by the national opera. The Lourve was a nice 20 minute walk and the Eiffel tower an adventerous hour. The rooms were small by American Standards but more than sufficent by European Standards. The hotel was very clean and the staff extremely helpful. We arrived via teh OST train station and the cab ride to the hotel was 6 Euro. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for couples of all ages”
Reviews.Author: Dougal15
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent four nights at this smallish, four star hotel in central Paris and would strongly recommend it for couples looking for a relaxing break. The hotel is conveniently situated very near to the the old Opera House. Most tourist attractions are within walking distance - depending on how fit you are! The Louvre is 10 - 15 minutes away, Place de la Concorde about the same. The Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe are further - about 45 minutes on foot. There are two metro stations near the hotel. The rooms vary in size but you get what you pay for. A complementary basket of fruit on arrival was a nice touch. The room and bathroom were spotless. The bathroom had a shower only - a bath would have been nice, but that was not a major issue. Towels, soap and shampoo were changed daily. Most of the rooms open on to an inner courtyard and were very quiet. There was no noticeable noise from any other areas. Air conditioning and safe deposit boxes are available in the rooms at no extra cost. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis. The breakfasts were excellent - juice, cereal, cheese, ham, bread, rolls, coffee, etc. The breakfast area is small but pleasant and the service was first class. The hotel does not really do other meals although I understand a room service menu is available. The hotel has a bar which is open until 10pm but we never actually saw anyone having a drink there. The staff are extremely efficient and friendly. They speak English but respond well to someone re-visiting school French! The hotel decor is quirky - we never really grasped the significance of the large number of orange plastic bears that are dotted around the place. The hotel is on five floors and the lift is small so we're not sure how accessible this hotel would be for wheel chair users. All in all this four star hotel offers comfortable city centre accommodation at an affordable price. We would certainly use it again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: meagang
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect choice for us, a couple in our mid 30s. The location was fantastic - near great shopping, a block away from two different metro stops, and within walking distance of many top tourist locations, although we often just took the metro as it was so easy and close. Because of the great location, we would not recommend buying a metro pass if you're staying at this hotel - it ended up being much cheaper to just buy the 10 pass Carnets for our visit than paying for the all-access pass. We noticed that the hotel was named the Hotel of the Year by the Golden Tulip chain, we could see why. Our courtyard-facing room had two twin beds pushed together as a king, and it worked perfectly. Great feather bedding and very comfortable mattresses gave us great nights of sleep. The courtyard protects the interior rooms from the city noise, and it was so quiet that we were able to sleep with our windows open every night and enjoy the great spring air. There was plenty of closet and drawer space as well. The bathroom, while small, was servicable and had a hairdryer and all of the toiletries one needs. One random tip for the ladies - the water in Paris is very hard and it made removing eye makeup with soap and water a very frustrating and difficult task. Taking along some makeup remover is highly advised. The only thing that we missed in terms of the room was having an additional mirror outside of the bathroom to make it easier for two people to get ready at the same time. Having an elevator was terriffic and much easier than hiking the stairs. We did not eat at the hotel, as there were many cheaper alternatives closeby, but we did buy wine several times from the bar and enjoyed it in the courtyard before bed. One block over there are many restaurants to choose from, as well as a market to pick up anything you may need. Cassa Bella was one of our favorites - delicious Italian food at a reasonable price. We also tried the Chinese restaurant on the next block and it was great as well. Although it seems wrong to eat fast food with all of the great food in Paris, a McDonalds is very close and was an easy place to stop for drinks and snacks when we were in a hurry. Internet access is available through a PC in the lobby on a pay-as-you-go basis - and we were glad that we hadnt lugged our laptop over with us. It was much easier to just pay the nominal fee for the 15 minutes a day that we needed. The staff was very kind and was able to help us with directions, reservations, and cab service whenever we needed it. Overall, this was a great hotel and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, conveniently located--but there are better choices for budget travellers.”
Reviews.Author: akpenguini
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a one-night stay in Paris based on Tripadvisor reviews and its proxmity to the Roissybus stop near Opera Garnier. It's a perfectly nice, clean hotel with polite staff. Personally, I didn't care for the Japanese decor, with its hard surfaces and partial partitions between the bedroom and the bathroom (the toilet is in a separate, closet-like room but there's nothing to deaden sound between rooms). What I liked least was being nickeled and dimed to death for extras like breakfast (another 15 Euros per person) and Internet use. Since Internet access was a major reason for selecting this 4 star hotel over the many 2 or 3 star options nearby, I was disappointed and annoyed. I also thought it was rather tacky to provide mini-fridges in the rooms posted with big signs indicating they are intended only for the in-room bar, not for the convenience of the guest. Choose this hotel if you really enjoy the novelty of Asian decor (or if it feels homey to you) and for its convenient location, cleanliness, and polite English-speaking staff. Avoid it if, like me, you are undismayed when staff in French hotels primarily speak French; are comfortable hauling your own bag up the stairs; and could feed yourself opulently for a day on 15 Euros invested at the local marketplace, provided you were permitted to make use of the room's refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Deffe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in early februari, when planning a romantic getaway with my girlfriend. The staff was very friendly, immediatly showing us around a bit in the lobby, pointing out where the elevator and the bar were and offering to carry our luggage despite the fact that we only had one rucksack and a sports bag with us because our trip would only last two days. When checking out we had the ability to leave our luggage in the bagagerie (luggage room) for the rest of the day. The hotel room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom (which accomodated a toilet, sink and a bathtub with shower) was very pleasing. The only negative thing I found was the lack of a shower curtain, but this isn't much of a problem as long as you take care not to splash around too much. There was a widescreen tv in our room, with a ton of French tv channels but also BBC World and CNN. As a Belgian neither really appeals to me, but I can assume Brithish or American visitors would appreciate the ability to keep up with affairs in their home country. There's also a possibility to have wired or wireless internet in the hotel, provided by Swisscom. You can buy a voucher for this at the reception desk. The breakfast buffet consists of a variety of things you'd expect to see in a typical French breakfast. There's a possibility to have breakfast delivered to your room as well. On a sidenote, there's a leisure club across the street where you get 30% off as a guest in Opéra de Noailles. Smokers will be happy to know that there's a tobacco shop down the street as well (Five euros a pack). Smoking in the hotel is obviously prohibited, but there's a little courtyard where you can smoke if you must. Getting to the hotel from the Gare du Nord is pretty easy using the metro using lines 4 and 3, stopping at Place de L'Opéra. Actually, practically anything in Paris is easily accessible using the subway system, as long as you follow the signs pointing to the various platforms properly and learn how to read the maps that are posted around the subway stations. All in all, I can definitely recommend Opera de Noailles, and I'll return here for sure when visiting Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: marikonanase
Reviews.Content: Every time I come to Paris I choose this hotel because is perfect to do business and enjoy the city. All is near, great shopping location and very kind staff people.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gowell1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and three children and found it to be a real haven of culture and quaity with great friendly staff. The late night staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel's recommendation of The Vaudeville Restaurant just around the corner off the Rue 4 September was spot on if you want a superb quality traditional French restaurant experience. Location excellent just 5 mins from the Opera Metro station. We will return ! London

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: SoleToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband, seven year old son and I stayed in the Golden Tulip Opera de Noailles from August 23rd to 29th this year. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. From the CDG airport, take the Roissy bus straight to the Opera and it is a few minute walk to the hotel. The hotel has an elevator, which is not so common for Paris; although it is small, it sure helped a lot with the huge three pieces of luggage that we had. The rooms are clean and neat, contemporary style, with balconies. The staff was extremely friendly, our son felt like at home in the director’s office since he wanted to play with Mme Caresmel’s dog each morning while we were having a leisurely breakfast. As for the breakfast itself: it was excellent, with a wide variety of options to choose from. For North Americans not willing to try the superb green tomato or fig jams (which I managed to find in a Provencal store and take home with me), there is cereal, orange juice etc. One can also sit outside in the small courtyard (weather permitting). An extremely nice touch from the Director was a bottle of champagne waiting in our room on my birthday (information leaked from our son). All in all, I do not think we will consider a different hotel next time we are in Paris. Family Baronian, Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mjb_lmi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights. It is a lovely, smaller hotel run by warm, amusing and helpful people. The room was stylish and comfortable and the bathroom a treat. Excellent location and experience.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mrs_p81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights during a recent trip to Paris, it was a last minute booking and we were very pleasently suprised. The hotel is just 5 minutes from Opera. Our room was nice and modern with a very swish glass wall for the bathroom. The staff were always very helpful and friendly. We didnt try the food so i couldnt comment but there is a lovely little patisserie on the corner of the street that a must! I would recommend this hotel, i have stayed in othes in Paris and this one is far better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: RMCOttawa
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a week in August 2006. My 5 night stay turned into 10 nights. I had an accident while in Paris and had to extend my stay at the hotel. I found the service to be extraordinary. The management and staff was more than helpful. The circumstances were particular and for the additional days I had to stay, they gave me a better rate than what I got when I booked with the travel agency.They upgraded the pillows in my room. Every day, the staff cleaned my room when I went down for breakfast and everyday, the staff in the kitchen prepared a special breakfast for me ( my jaw was broken). When I got back to my room, I found an ice bucket on the table with ice for the compresses I was using for my face. I didn't ask for any of this. They just did it. They even let me bring in my own dinner and let me prepare it in the little kitchen area. The staff was not only helpful, but caring. It made an otherwise horrific visit into a very decent stay. I'm going back to Paris in October of this year (2008) and I booked a room there again. If I have a bad day during my stay in Paris, I know that I will staying in a safe and welcoming place.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Tulip Opera De Noailles-Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Wehogirl
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through BA Holidays and chose it for the value and location. Price has gone up a bit, with the value of the dollar sinking. It is a wonderful little hotel, with a very friendly and helpful staff. The room I was assigned was not that small, the bed was very comfortable and the air -conditioning worked well. Housekeeping did a great job of cleaning but sometimes would leave the window open and flies would be in the room. In Europe, most places do not have window screens and this is one of them. One of the things that I wished the room had was a kettle. The continental breakfast was one of the best I have experienced, with all sorts of meats, cheeses, yogurts, breads, cereals, and fresh fruit. My favorite pastry, at the hotel breakfast, was an apple tart-I found it to be absolute perfection. Location of the hotel is ideal, you can't do better.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favourite - but...”
Reviews.Author: Savoya
Reviews.Content: This is definately my favourite hotel in Paris (considering my budget). Great location, friendly staff, surprising design features, nice rooms, clever lay out, but... we were lucky. Friends travelling with us stayed in the same hotel, at the same rate but didn't really get what we got. They walked into a really tiny and a little run down room, and the bathroom was very tiny and didn't 'feel' clean. So picking this hotel is like playing the lottery. You can get lucky - like we did, or you can be less lucky like our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Boutique Hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: fpkp
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris and stayed at this wonderful smaller hotel in a great area. There are two metro stops within walking distance, although it is very walkable to sites like the Louvre. When we first arrived we were shown three possible rooms, of which we picked one but had second thoughts. The next morning they happily showed us another room which we loved. It was on the 6th floor (rm 602). It had a big terrace outside, a much larger room (although they are still on the small side compared to North America) and lots of privacy. The rooms were very clean, the staff was great. Recommendations were given for dinner a few nights and we were never disappointed. I would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Tulip Noailles Is a Genuine Find”
Reviews.Author: philmonthow
Reviews.Content: I booked the Golden Tulip Noailles as part of my British Airways flight, and I must tip my hat to them. They list a few dozen hotels, but only three are "recommended." This one well deserves that recommendation. The location is perfect, five minutes from the Opera and the great department stores, 10 minutes from the Louvre, and a few minutes from two Metro stations. The staff gives the lie to all the stereotypes people have of rude Parisians. I had a computer problem and a young man came up immediately and solved it in no time. All the front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Contrary to a review on this site that claimed the breakfast is set out at 7 and just sits there, I saw the trays constantly replenished -- with an astonishing array of offerings: great cold cuts, first rate, ripe cheese, fresh fruit (including stewed rhubarb, which was in season while I was there), yogurt, cereal, as well as the great French bread and delectable croissants. The room was small but had everything I needed. The bed was comfortable. A minute down the street was the Restaurant Drouant, where I had one of the best meals ever. Restaurants featuring every cuisine are on the surrounding streets. When I go back to Paris I shall certainly go back to the Noailles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Best Area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: YNWA1967
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Paris and stayed at the Hotel De Noailles. We picked this hotel based on 2 months of research for a great hotel in a great location. Although the room we had for our first night was very nice, I had requested a balcony. The friendly staff told me that they would show me more rooms the next day and that I could choose from them. We ended up taking room # 602. Top floor overlooking the main (quiet) street. It had the largest terrace in the hotel and ran the length of our room and could be accessed from 2 sets of double doors. Although the rooms are small for North American standards, this room was more than adequate , especially with the extra room to enjoy on the terrace. We walked to the metro which was 2 minutes away and travelled all over Paris, very easily. When you come out of the Metro, you will be stunned by the gorgeous view of the Opera every-time. We had coffee and croissants at the famous Cafe de la Paix several times which is located in the Opera Square. We took the Roissy Bus from the Airport (and back to the airport when we left) for $8.50 Euro and it drops you of on Rue Scribe, right beside the Opera and 4-5 minute walk to the hotel. You can walk to the Arc and back all in one afternoon if you like to walk. We walked to the Jardin Tuilleires (gorgeous) then to the Louvre and then along the Champs Ellyses all the way to the Arc and back (stopping at amazing cafes all along the way) They also are 5 minutes away from les Galleries Lafayette, amazing shopping. (Go to the perfume section on the first floor and look up at the incredible dome for a great picture) We had the trip of a lifetime to celebrate my wife's birthday, but it was more like a second honeymoon because of the City, the hotel and the great , friendly staff. (Especially Nicholas & Grisele) We will be staying there the next time we come back to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: thecamp
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable 5 nights stay. Staff friendly and helpful. Very clean Good food

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: gdm86
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful as well as the rooms. Excellent located and outstanding attention. If I return to Paris, I will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fanatastic stay, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: jptChicago
Reviews.Content: Great Stay, great locatiobn, great staff! Staff extremely helpful and courteous. make sure to reserve a room on the 6th floor with a balacony on the street side off the hotel. My fiance and I had coffee every morning on it and it was great. Also, for a great dining experience, try the restaurant on the corner ( one block down to the right when exiting the hotel) its the one with the fountain out front. The food was A+ and the service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Golden Tulip”
Reviews.Author: LiadY
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone, We went to Paris on a romantic vacation, and stayed in the Golden Tulip between 8-12/5. We really enjoyed, it is a GREAT hotel! Location: The hotel is located 5 minutes away from 2 metro stations (which is very important), and right next to the old opera building (one of the most beautiful buildings in Paris, on my opinion). It's in the heart of a very nice and live full, luxurious area of shops and restaurants, and very close (15 minutes walking) to the Luvre and the beautiful Tuillery gardens. It's convenient location allows you to get to most of the sites by foot, and it's friendly area allows you to come back even late at night and to feel safe. Although it's central location, The hotel's street itself is very quiet. Rooms: Beautiful rooms, we got one with garden view. The rooms are well decorated, very clean and tidy. The bed is big and comfortable, there's a lot of closet room for your things, and everything looks very good. We were very impressed by the room when we got in, you can tell that the standard is very high. The rooms are air-conditioned, and well furnished. The bathroom is also impressively decorated and clean, with 2 exceptions: 1. The door between the bathroom and the room itself is made of glass (even though you can't see anything), so be prepared for a little intimacy boost :) 2. Our room didn't have shower curtain and shower-head holder on the wall, but we understood from the reception it's like that only in some of the rooms. All with all, it was a great room to come back to in the end of the day. Breakfast, Staff and Facilities: The staff is very nice and English-speaking. There's always someone at the reception, and they are willing to help with everything. The breakfast was a very pleasant surprise - it's very rich, with lots of cheese types, cereal, meat, croissants, etc. And all is delicious :) Definitely a good way to start your day. We highly recommend to take it (Our deal was 170 Euros per night, including breakfast). You can have breakfast in the room with no extra charge. The hotel has sauna and gym, although we didn't quite use them. To sum up - We REALLY enjoyed this hotel, it had a good share of the great vacation we had in Paris, and it's highly recommended for couples. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: arfurdaley
Reviews.Content: Had a Lovely relaxing stay at the 'Noailles' with a great location within only 10 minutes walk from the Louvre. Great shopping around this area if that's your thing. Was greeted with a warm welcome on arrival and being earlier than we expected we were offered a room hours before normal check-in but declined this due to having the option of a balcony room a little later. All the hotel staff we encountered were very polite and helpful and we would not hesitate in recommending the hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “excelent choice”
Reviews.Author: fabiosoler
Reviews.Content: .Great place to stay!!, a modern boutique hotel in a excellent central area, close to everything - walking distance to the major sites of the city, lots of restaurants,cafes and shopping Nice and comfortable room and bath, quiet place with a lovely decor, good size for Paris. Charming style and clean Good breakfast, not too much amenities (its a little hotel) Helpful staff (this is one of the top points), nice and friendly people helps us for everything Overall an excellent choice for this area and price range Choose this hotel its one of the best 4star in town I as a travel agent and leader of a big group, enjoy our stay Mrs. Celine (sales manager) give us a big support with a good rate and care with my friends. Fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Noailles, Paris”
Reviews.Author: feef63
Reviews.Content: 13 of us ranging from the ages of 13 to 79 were extremely well looked after at Hotel Noailles in Paris. Celine was particularly helpful before we arrived organising a suitable room for my mother as well as organising bus trip, boat trip and meal in restaurant nearby. All staff throughout our stay were very friendly. Breakfasts were good and there is a lovely relaxed atmosphere in the hotel bar. The rooms were great. Everything clean, comfortable and exactly what you'd want. The location is great too. I would definitely book another stay in this hotel next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsJCat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during part of our honeymoon. We stayed in the Junior Suite, which was 485 Euros/night, but we were on our honeymoon! They do have reasonably priced single and double rooms for tourists and vacationers. Our room was lovely, very spacious for a hotel room in Paris and it had a terrace, so we were very happy to be able to eat breakfast every morning outside. The location is very convenient for metro access and for shopping at the luxury department stores Printemps and Galleries Lafayette. Many of the major tourist attractions were within walking distance. The staff here were always cheerful and helpful to us. They also gave us great suggestions for restaurants, etc. All in all, I would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, modern, Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: try2travelyes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent find. It has a great location near Opera and 3 metro stations. It was a little pricey, but we got a deal by booking 3 more days making it a great deal! The rooms are quite large for Paris hotel rooms, the beds were quite comfy and the bathroom was very spacious. We had a great time. The front desk staff were Extremely helpful and very friendly. The bar is okay, but again the service was great and friendly. I highly recommend this hotel it was an absolute joy!

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Noailles is a very good hotel, that is well situated not far from opera and boulevard des italiens. Their website was easy to book on, the hotel looks good from the outside and, better still, the room and bathroom were suprisingly modern and large for Paris. The front of house staff were very helpful, including assisting carrying our skiis for a block. You could hear a light rumbling from the metro, but this is common anywhere in Paris. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: gillers25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in Paris. In a city of overpriced hotels, this was a welcome change. Great location, anout 5 mins walk from the Roissy-Bus terminus at Opera. Small hotel, not many facilities, but great location and really well decorated. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: fifi_chu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opera in January 2008. It is a great hotel, although the rooms were not huge, they are perfectly formed, and were actually bigger than I thought they were going to be (based on other reviews on this website), plus the bathroom was huge! the only tip I would say is try not to stay in room 8 (on the ground floor) if you are not an early riser. Although it is a gorgeous room, overlooking the outside patio, we were woken at 6.00am with the staff setting up for breakfast. They weren't being intentionally noisy, and the noise couldn't be helped, but it wake us up. Alright if you are planning on getting up at that time, but not if you want a lie in! We then moved to room 110, which being a corner room was a bit bigger than the other rooms we saw, plus it had a walk in shower and a big bath which was heaven after walking around Paris! The location couldn't have been better, right near two stations, Opera and Quatre-Septembre. You can walk pretty much anywhere from the hotel, my boyfriend and I walked all the way up to the Champs Elysee and Arc de Triomphe. I can't say what the breakfast was like as we didn't eat at the hotel, but it did look nice! Overall this was a great hotel, I would stay there again in a heartbeat and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Alphafighter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sept 2007 for a week in Paris. Location is excellent, as we were withing walking distance of at least 4 subway stations and lots of tourist busses. Staff was extremely helpful, rooms was clean and modern. The only downside was the room was so small, but that's the norm around Paris. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: al_kennedy
Reviews.Content: Searching for a hotel in Paris isn't easy because there are just so many choices. Do you select by location? Price? Brand? All of the above? On our last trip to Paris we wanted something nice since we would be there for New Years eve. The Golden Tulip was a great find. The location is perfect. It is just a few steps from the Opera (and the Metro) but the street itself is quite quiet. The rooms are note huge, but very well laid out. The beds were extremely comfortable! The only odd thing was the bathroom. The door and walls of the bathroom are frosted glass. This is fine for a couple but if you are with a friend, plan on getting to know them very well. There is also no sound insulation and it sounds like the person is brushing their teeth right beside you. The hallways are the only thing that look like they need to be upgraded a bit. The hotel staff was VERY friendly and they all seem to speak at least some English. There is no restaurant in the hotel but there are plenty nearby. There is also no parking in the hotel itself but you can find that rather close as well, but it will be expensive. This isn't a cheap hotel but I think it was good value for money. I'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DingDing2k
Reviews.Content: Just around the corner from the Opera (which looks amazing lit up at night) and handy for everywhere really, as there are Metro stations very close. Great rooms and the staff are efficient and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey and small rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: 3nations_family
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in late November, the off season in Paris. Our "superior" double room was very small but quiet and overlooking the courtyard on the 5th floor. The location of this hotel is ideal for sightseeing in Paris as you can walk easily to The Louvre/ Opera/ Tuillerie gardens if the weather is OK and there are a few metro stations close by. The breakfast was fresh and plentiful and served until 11am with regular top ups. My only 2 issues were the tiny lift- which only takes 2 people and 2 suitcases, the only alternative to which is a spiral staircase. Not ideal for limited mobility people or at busy times. The other issue is the value for money - we paid €185 per night which was the best deal we could get at Booking.com having trawled elsewhere. Although this was including breakfast, I thought for the very small room and limited facilities offered by the hotel (no leisure activities/ tiny and empty bar area/ no real lounging area) that it was very expensive. The rooms are modern in decor and they are in the process of doing up the remaining rooms on the first floor to the same standard. Our bathroom was Ok but the shower was only a hand held one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: callies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights the first of Sept. This location is perfect. Took the Roissey Bus from CDG, 8 euros, takes you two blocks from the hotel near the Opera House. We took a cab and was shocked it was so close, we could have easily walked. Staff at the hotel all speak English and were very helpful. We had the junior suite and it was very large for european hotels. The decor was wonderful, was very very clean and such a tucked away quiet location. Was our first trip so we were apprehensive at first but we had such a great time. We found the locals to be very nice and always helpful. Choose cafe's with an English description of their menu. Went to two great upscale restaurants that had the menus in French but each time the waiter was very helpful. The La Fontaine Gaillon, right behind the hotel, is a great choice. Only open during the week. The Dirigeable Rest in the 15th is such a quaint place and worth the effort to get there. 37 rue d'Alleray is the address. Take a cab. We walked almost everywhere in Paris from our hotel. The Metro (stop very nearby) is convenient we just did not need it, except to get the train to Versailles. Went on Sat when the fountains were running. Breathtaking. Used the open bus to see the sights and took a boat ride on the Seine at night. What a view of the lights. The top of the Eiffel Tower is worth the effort. Would recommend this hotel, a little pricey but not out of line in Paris. Would stay there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Gav D
Reviews.Content: Spent a great 2 nights with my wife and infant son during the Rugby World Cup. I love the Opera area and always try to stay in the area but this hotel made it even more enjoyable. The hotel is well located for both metro travel (nearest metro station is Opera, about 2 minutes walk from the hotel) as well as walking. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The cold buffet breakfast in the morning was very nice (the only thing missing was a highchair for my son). We stayed in a triple room which was a nice size. The rooms are very modern with all expected conveniences. The hotel has 2 Japanese restaurants either side of it. We went to the more modern looking restaurant on the left hand side as you exit the hotel and the sushi was some of the best that I've ever eaten (at well below London prices!). All in all a great experience. I'll definitely stay there again on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Right Where I Wanted To Be”
Reviews.Author: TLMinnesota
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel in the heart of Paris that was convenient to the Metro and close enough to walk to museums (Louvre, Orangerie) if I wished. I also wanted a comfortable hotel with a helpful staff, since I was new to Paris. The Golden Tulip Opera de Noailles fit my needs perfectly. My wife and I were given a room with a king-size bed and a balcony, perfect for late evening relaxing and rest. In addition, the location was so close to the Metro, we were able to tour in the morning, come back and rest after lunch, and then return to touring and dinner with little travel time. The staff, who spoke excellent English, was very helpful in pointing out directions and additional attractions (i.e. shopping at Galleries Lafayette). All of this combined for a wonderful stay. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: Heloro
Reviews.Content: We could have spent much more on a hotel and not had a better experience than we had. (As it was, we booked this hotel through British Air along with our air tickets, and they saved us a considerable amount.) The staff of this hotel was Johnny-on-the-Spot for anything and everything. The rooms & bathroom, while small by USA standards but typical for Paris, were beautifully kept, neat and clean, modern, and very, very comfortable. There was a small cigarette burn in the couch, and that's about all that marred a perfect hotel room. We were disappointed at the expensive connection for internet, but frankly, it probably served to keep us from frittering away precious time on the internet and spending more outside enjoying Paris! There is, however, an inexpensive internet cafe one block away from the hotel. The breakfast provided with the room was excellent -- great variety, very tasty. Be sure to try all of the jellies they provide (they tasted homemade, but we didn't ask.) The staff was wonderful, coming up in an instant when we called to say there was a problem with the hot water (the housekeeper had accidentally turned it off) or the air conditioning (we had opened the window, which automatically switches off the a.c.). Each time we called, they came so quickly, we thought they "apparated" up to our room, a la Harry Potter! Really, they were all terrific. We asked them to book 2 shows for us, which they did immediately (the Ballet of Cuba was wonderful; but if you've ever been to Las Vegas, skip the Moulin Rouge, it is sure to disappoint; try a different cabaret). All in all, we give 5 stars for this hotel, which, although not the cheapest, could not have been better at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: fredouimett
Reviews.Content: During our last trip to Europe we made our reservation at the Golden Tulip Opera De Noailles Hotel. We were amazed at how clean and charming the place was. The staff were very polite and courteous As for location it is one of the best in Paris. We can walked to the Opera, Le Louvre, St-Michel, St-Germain and right near the metro. We strongly recommend it Fred Ouimet

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ReniNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Paris on June 23, 2007. Aside from Paris being a magnificent city, the Golden Tulip Opera de Noailles made our vacation even more so. The hotel is located on a side street in the Opera District which is so convenient to everything. Once you walk through the doors of this hotel you are amazed your in Paris. The hotel has a Zen Japenese feel, very modern and very charming. When I booked I requested a room with a private patio, we were told they could not guarantee this, but to our suprised we did get one of these unbelieveable charming room. The room is small but wonderfully planned out with a large very modern bathroom, the private patio we had was small but so charming it has a table and two chairs with jasmine trees and other foilage completely surrounding our patio. What a treat in the middle of Paris to wake up and have your breakfast surrounded by trees and birds on your private patio. The price of the room included a full breakfast which had everything from your typical french pastries to fruit, cheese, eggs meats and so on. The staff went out of their way to help, with everything from suggesting fantastic restuarants to site seeing advise. The whole staff speaks fluent english which is very helpful. We already are planning our next trip there, because of the wonderful experience. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a quite refuge in this very busy city. We are from New York City and have travelled extensively, but this was quite a delightful surprise even for us. Renee & Jack New York City

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: craquell
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris. Our hotel was booked via a travel agent. The hotel was clean and charming but the service was terrible. Prob. the worst service I have ever experienced. The front desk sent us to a restaraunt that was literally shut down. Looked like it had been out of business for months. Then, we went to the bar to relax b/f heading out for the evening and there was no one working. We asked the front desk and they sent someone over to take our order and make our drinks. Once the drinks were made (one round) the woman wished us a good evening and went out with her friends (whom were waiting for her while she served us). That was it. No more bar service. Finally, we checked out and went to the English countryside. When I arrived I realized that I left the painting I had purchased in the room. I had a hotel rep. in England, who spoke French, call the front desk. When she told them I had left the painting and could they ask housekeeping if it was found, the front desk clerk said "sorry, no painting was found". He didnt even bother asking anyone, he just said sorry. I called again the next morning in hopes of talking to someone more helpful and they did the same thing. So, make sure you dont leave anything behind. The last thing, the area the hotel is in lacks restaraunt choices, esp in the evening. I would stay near the latin quarter and when we visit again, we will NOT be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: caughtthetravelbug
Reviews.Content: With a metro station a few minutes stroll away, the Opera de Noailles was located perfectly to explore Paris! The room was fantastic - really clean and spacious, a little too hot, but management came and sorted out the air conditioning for us which was great! The only gripe that we had about the room was the shower, which you had to hold above your head which made washing hair etc a bit tricky. Apart from that the bathroom was lovely. Our favourite thing about this hotel was the continental breakfast which was fantastic! There was so much choice of food which was all replenished regularly so nothing went cold/tasted stale. The only thing is, the lift in the hotel is tiny, so not sure it would suit anyone using a wheelchair. And the bar closes at 10pm, which was a little early for our liking. Overall, with the friendly staff, big, clean rooms, we found little to grumble about and thought that it was a fantastic hotel which we'd definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: al52c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice place to stay while traveling for business or pleasure. My husband and I spent a few nights and we were quite happy with the hotel accommodations and the service we received from the staff. The thing we enjoyed most was being able to walk to most points of interest within the city. There was easy access to public transportation as well. We had a wonderful visit overall and we feel this hotel was an ideal place for us to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shakerfelix
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Booked over the internet and read Trip Advisor reviews. It deserved its good reviews. The hotel is in a great location. Very clean and friendly staff. Breakfasts are superb with a selection to suit all. Only disadvantage was that there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is rather pricey around this particular area in the restaurants but having said that, the quality of all the meals we had was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff, and Room”
Reviews.Author: ahumm
Reviews.Content: We just spent 6 nights at the Golden Tulip for our first visit to Paris and loved it! Our flight arrived at 7:30 am on a Sunday morning, so we showed up to the hotel much earlier than their 1pm check in time. They had been booked solid the night before, but held our luggage for us while we went and got breakfast, and let us check in at 10am once they had our room ready., for no extra charge. The room was beautiful. It had a large bathroom with tub and shower, large windows next to the bed from ceiling to floor that were great to open up in the morning, and was super clean and modern. Bed was very comfy and they provided 4 big, fluffy pillows in the room as well. The staff was always helpful, providing umbrellas on the one day it rained while we were there, recommending good places to eat, and always happy to see us when we arrived back from a long day. The location was amazing. We were able to walk everywhere, and if you don't like walking there is a metro stop around the corner. The Opera house is around the corner, and the Louvre is within a few blocks. There are a ton of great restaurants next door to the hotel, across the street, around the corner, basically everywhere. Also a little market and many patisserie's nearby too. It was hard to get lost or run out of things to do since the moment you check in, they had you a map with all the major tourist sights well-marked on it, and a stack of brochures with things to do. Also a nice book was left in the room for us with even more recommendations. Would definitely stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm - distinctly average”
Reviews.Author: ArmadilloLondon
Reviews.Content: Agree with Petrushka. We too booked largely on the strength of reviews here and felt others have been rather generous with their hyperbole. Bed not very comfortable and room as small as one expects in Paris. Biggest problem was that the only opening windows were full length french doors opening on to the central courtyard so we weren't happy about sleeping with them open. Location certainly central but won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel,2 thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: QTRXist
Reviews.Content: I don’t write that many reviews even though I travel abroad 3 to 4 times per year. But I felt compelled to write this one! I heard about this family run place from my friends who stayed here last year. So based on theri recommendation, on my way back from Israel, I stayed here for 4 nights. I must tell you that I was very happy with every aspect of my stay in this hotel. This is an excellent location, so close to the opera and the shopping areas around. There is a supermarket and metro station in walking distance. On my arrival, I was greeted warmly and within 5 minutes was helped up to my room with my two HUGE luggages which the poor guy at this hotel howled up the stairs for me with a smile. The room is high tech, very functional with a full size bath tub and ample counter space for my tons of bottles of products and toiletry. I read another review here that claims that the wall dividing the bathroom from the room itself is see-through. This is simply NOT true! It is thick glass and frosted to the point of complete discretion. I wish i ahd a photo! The bath and shower in my room were spanking brand new! The bedding was soft and plush, super white and clean as heaven! There was a big basket of fruit in my room, apples and oranges and grapes and pears wrapped up very nicely welcoming me to Paris! The breakfast was absolutely great, with fresh jams, nutella (mmmm...yummy), hard boiled eggs, cold cuts, fresh pastry, cereal, great coffee, an assortment of cheeses and that wonderful French bread I could not get enough of! This hotel was a delight to say the least, in a country known for its unfriendliness to the American tourist. The hotel staff is super nice. Every body smiles all the time and they all speak good english which is rare in France! What is prompting me to write this review though is what I saw on my last day. I saw the hotel owner helping another American tourist whose passport had been stolen. As the tourist was panicking, the hotel owner calmed her down and assured her everything will be ok. She then made calls to the police and the American embassy for these guys and I heard from them in the evening that travel papers were arranged for them that same day with the help of the hotel owner! Now that is service! When you are stranded in a country and you don’t know your way around, wouldn’t you want to get TLC like this? I certainly would! Two thumbs up for this hotel. I highly recommend them and will definitely come back !

Reviews.Title: “Great service, cleanliness and location”
Reviews.Author: FidoOman
Reviews.Content: This is not my first trip to a European city, and all in all, my experience at the Golden Tulip Opera De noailles Hotel was a great one. First the reservation was done directly with the hotel, who was prompt and clear Arriving to the hotel, the location is amazing, in the heart of Paris, this saves you a lot in terms of transportation if you take taxis, as it is walking distance from many attractions. the hotel staff was great, from receptionist to bellboy, this reflects a great management and attention to detail in all. the hotel rooms are adequate to Parisian hotel rooms in size, and the facilities are as great as in a 5 star hotel. the hotel decoration has a lot of taste, with little details. I highly recommend this hotel to any person visiting Paris Fady

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Tarkhisis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights in Feburary this year. We had a double room on the 6th floor. The hotel has a small lift which helps with the luggage. It looked exactly like it does in the photos and we found it aqequate but a bit small. We had no problems as the room was cleaned daily and quite. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is easily accessible from the Opera Metro station (which is less than 5 minutes walk) and you can easily walk to the Lourve/D Orsay museum. There are many restaraunts in the area (surrounding Opera) which can be a bit pricy - which is expected in a tourist area and a local department store. We had no problems with safety as the streets are well lit and there are many people around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Petrushka3
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a week at the Tulip and I must say were hugely disapointed at pretty much every aspect of the hotel. Whilst the location is good and thanks to the excellent Paris Metro, offers great access to everywhere in the city, the hotel itself was in my opinion sub-standard. On arrival our greeting was not terribly warm and it took a considerable time for our booking to finally be acknowledged and to be shown to our room. Obviously the building was not designed as a hotel so there is only a tiny lift or narrow staircase to use. Our room was very small and functional with no real sophistication or specific quality although there was a great balcony. The real issue for me was the bathroom - this had been crammed into the room by putting a very thin and simple dividing plastic/glass wall! Not only did this make the room even smaller, but being frosted plastic/glass it didn't exactly allow for much discretion! The bath and shower itself was also old, tiny and unimpressive. In short the room was terrible in my opinion. Two other issues I had were the fact that the bar closes at 22:00 - the bedrooms are not nearby so I just couldn't see the logic and the breakfast was simply awful! Tepid rubbish that was clearly just left on the heaters since being put out at 07:00! (fine if you want to get up at that time on holiday). I genuinely don't write bad reviews for the sake of it and actually chose this hotel on the basis of strong comments on trip-advisor, but I'm sorry to say this hotel was simply a huge disapointment and I would certainly not recommend it. Whilst the last thing you want to do on a city break is spend much time in your hotel room - it makes a significant difference if it's a room you look forward to getting back to - this wasn't!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: chickeeVancouver
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and enjoy returning to Paris and to our favorite hotel in the Opera district - once again, the family runned hotel came through and provided us yet again a wonderful home away from home! We look forward to their copious breakfast always and normally conclude our day by enjoying a quiet drink in their lounge. The staff is discreet and very service oriented - what else can one want as an escape? Overall in location, value & ambiance, this is our choice!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, crisp, friendly and well designed”
Reviews.Author: PacketCat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 7 nights and loved them all. While the room is small, it is in step wityh European design, it is clean and wonderfully designed to make it livable. The staff is friendly and accomodating. They were truely human. The beds are comfortable and lighting in the room is perfect. Did I say how clean everything was? The elevator is small and you get to meet the other guests. The shower is a challenge for Americans, but we were able to keep clean without too much of a mess. We ate at the cafe on the corner and saved a bit of money. With the American dollar in the tank it was worth walking the 15 steps. They were friendly too. There is a Metro Stop a block away, it is closer than Opera and is the 4 Sept. station. Coming out of the Metro go left one block and make left and you are there. Buy the ten trip Metro package. There is a great bakery up the street too. Shopping is three blocks away and there is a bus that goes to the airport nearby. I love Paris, my oh my do I love Paris because of my stay at this Tulip hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved GT Opera De Noailles”
Reviews.Author: mcat19
Reviews.Content: Golden Tulip Opera de Noailles is perfectly located in central Paris. From CDG take the Roissy bus (approx.€8) and it is only a 5 minute walk to the Hotel. Opera is a fantastic area for cafes and restaurants and shopping is only a few minutes walk at Haussman/Gallaries Lafayette! Opera Metro is nearby. The hotel is clean, warm and safe and is perfect for a base in Paris. While the triple room is small for three people it is sufficient- we stayed three days and it was more than fine. Breakfast is good and plentiful! Unfortunately, work is ongoing on the Spa facilites (but no noise disturbance) and it was closed, but will open again soon. A brilliant place to stay and a good base to see the sights! Staff are helpful and friendly, rooms are clean and quiet and location is fantastic! Recommend to couples, families or business travellers. Will certainly use again on next trip to Paris. It is worth remembering four star in Paris is not quite four star elsewhere! 8.5/10

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice hotel, kindly staff”
Reviews.Author: David38
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, quiet, nice new and old furnitures. Near the bus from the airport. Close to shopping and cafees.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Week End”
Reviews.Author: jeanpierrebiarritz
Reviews.Content: What a lovely week end in Paris I spent with my wife, mainly due to the warmest welcome I never had in a Paris hotel. I spent two nights in Hotel de Noailles, a perfect location in the middle of the city, and the kindness of the hotel manager as well as all members of staff helped us to find all resons to come back as soon as possible. The decoration of the room, the atmosphere of the lobby and the quality of the breakfast made the stay unique and the price was incredibly reasonnable compared to the standing of this hotel. I will recommand it to everyone who plans to visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we had 4 magical days in Paris and the hotel was the cherry on top!
